Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion thread
nn_summary: The user is excited about the new features in Notion and is looking forward to using them in their work.

Text:
Weve used couple times Figmas observation mode while user testing We noticed that if your prototype has animation which contains overlay that overlay is not visible for observators Only person who is using prototype can see overlays This is critical problem which deteriorates observation feature
Hello everyone I encountered the same issue and noticed that it only occurred when the overlay was triggered by an instance As a temporary solution I detached the instance which allowed me to view the overlay in observation mode
I hope this can help
nn_summary: User experienced a critical issue with Figma's observation mode, where the overlay was not visible for observers. They discovered that the issue only occurred when the overlay was triggered by an instance. A temporary solution was to detach the instance, allowing the user to view the overlay in observation mode.

Text:
Miro solves two huge problems for me 
 
1 Remote working and having collaborative sessions with other team members Before I found Miro having these sessions was incredibly hard 
2 When you write on a whiteboard at some stage it gets rubbed off Miro you can have endless whiteboards that you never need to delete
Miro is incredibly helpful for a number of reasons The best way to look at it is like a whiteboard with all the relevant tools online You can use it for brainstorming sessions mapping customer journeys comparing notes and heaps more It feels like I have only just scraped the surface with what is possible on Miro

Ive noticed some hiccups when sharing boards with free license users that require to actively collaborate on the board
nn_summary: Users appreciate Figma's remote collaboration capabilities, Jira card integration, canvas design, and various features such as templates, app integrations, presentation tools, and AI components. However, they experience issues when sharing boards with free license users who need to actively collaborate.

Text:
Miro provides an ideal software solution for collecting comments and feedback on wireframe designs showing what they would look like with elements rearranged and sharing them with others we are collaborating with 
Team members can review content in their own time and leave postit notes comments and annotations with the flexibility to be able to draw cut and paste etc to get thoughts across When we provide our feedback to others its very clear which part of the design each piece of feedback relates to and visually shows what we think it should look like
Very flexible easy to use intuitive keyboard shortcuts for adding elements to the board make it quick to get thoughts down Default colours and styles look good 
Easier to navigate than visio
Doesnt have BPMN symbols and swimlane structure where space can easily be added in the middle of a diagram so not well suited for process mapping  I still use visio for that
nn_summary: Users find Miro ideal for collecting feedback on wireframe designs and collaborating with team members, as it is flexible, easy to use, and has intuitive keyboard shortcuts. However, it lacks BPMN symbols and swimlane structures, making it less suitable for process mapping compared to Visio.

Text:
Miro supports our team as a platform for digital collaboration  it facilitates hybrid work transitioning our information from the remote environment into the office and back
Having worked in mixed creative product and engineering teams I find Miro an effective tool for visual thinking and documentation The tools are accessible for newcomers to adopt but scale well for power users to leverage templates and tools that adapt to content and user needs across a project or workflows stages
Whether at the boardlevel or the teamlevel its up to individuals and their teams to manage board sprawl and keep things organized Depending on the information guidelines of your organization there may be some friction involved in ensuring that the right individuals are granted the correct level of access to certain types of content in a timely manner
nn_summary: Users find Figma valuable for replacing physical whiteboards in discovery and brainstorming sessions, as well as for teambuilding and engagement during meetings. It is user-friendly, intuitive, and compatible with other tools. However, some users face challenges with overlapping toolboxes and sharing options, especially for external or infrequent users.

Text:
Were a hybrid company and working in Product we often need to have collaborative sessions across teams where some members are remote and some are in person This is by far the best replacement for oldfashioned inperson whiteboarding with sticky notes and its even better because you can save it and easily access it later
Its been conducive to facilitating collaboration on designs whiteboarding brainstorming process reviews and strategy sessions Figjams design makes it easy to use for a wide variety of scenarios Weve used it asynchronously to prep for a discussion as well as simultaneously inmeeting as a way to accomplish inperson whiteboardingtype conversations especially when some participants are remote
The UI took a little getting used to and there was a short learning curve to figure out how to access different elements and add them to the page
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's remote collaboration capabilities, allowing colleagues to access and work on the board simultaneously, improving productivity and meeting deadlines. However, they find the default templates and sticky notes to be too small.

nn_summary: Users appreciate Figjam for its ease of use, templates, and integration with Figma, making it a convenient collaboration tool for both designers and non-designers. However, they find its customization options limited, particularly regarding shapes, colors, and fonts, and wish for more detailed wireframing capabilities. This sometimes leads to a tedious process of creating shapes in Figma and pasting them into Figjam.

Text:
Figjam has helped solve some of our collaboration problems with having a distributed and remote team Brainstorming and collaboration meetings that previously were done in person in a meeting room with whiteboards are now done using Figjam
Figjam is a great collaboration tool for brainstorming new ideas and recording different types of data in a consolidated space It has been great in helping to discuss and plan large projects by providing a single place where all the different aspects of the project can be stored and shared
There is actually very little that I dislike about Figjam It serves its purpose very well
nn_summary: Users appreciate Figma for its ability to develop processes in one place and share progress with colleagues and leadership, resulting in increased productivity. They find Miro intuitive, well-organized, and great for collaboration in hybrid environments, with visually appealing presentation tools. However, they suggest improvements in diagramming options, such as exporting diagrams directly to Visio or other flow tools for easier integration into external documentation.

Text:
After using the AI tool for a while I ran into some issues and also found some toolsplatforms suitable for lazy people
Lets read the conclusion first I recommend the poe_platform platform The supported bots are also quite rich There are no IP requirements and if you have advanced requirements you can directly subscribe on the Poe platform
ChatGPT 
Currently I mainly use Claudes robot on the Poe platform Heres a summary of the advantages Ive discovered
1 Responses will be faster than ChatGPT in Chinese conversations
2 The corpus will be updated in due course I dont know the frequency but at least he can help me sort out the relatively new content Layer2 and Starknet
3 Writing and copywriting skills seem to be stronger than ChatGPT subjective feeling
Lets take a look at other AI tool products in detail
1chatGPT
There are strict restrictions on IP and a global proxyprivacy window must be attached to it before it can be used
There are unstable situations For example I went to WeChat to send a message to him halfway through the conversation and when I came back I had to refresh the page before I could use it
There are occasional interruptions in answering so I need to remind him to continue
In the end he blocked me which is the biggest problem with using it so far 

2Google Bard Google fought back against OpenAIs products Currently I havent been able to experience them due to IP issues so I abandoned them according to the purpose of our lazy people According to feedback from some friends there is still a certain gap between product power and ChatGPT

3Claude
The founder is the former executive vice president of OpenAI This product is very popular in the investment community Its a bit like the capital that didnt invest in Tesla back then placed a heavy bet on Lucid
Its currently completely free to use and supports use of  on Poe and Slack
4Poe
This is an integrated platform made by Quora that supports mainstream AI conversation tools GPT4 and Claude paid subscriptions are also supported
Its the best toolplatform to use so far and you can use it without having to connect to a global agent or open a ladder

5BuddyGPT
This is a GPT robot on Telegram which will be more friendly to heavy TG users Theres a free version but it only supports 10 free messages per month and the subscription costs 599month

6Defalsh
Web3 content aggregation platform with GPT as the information processing engine
There is no need to register and you can use it with authorization through the Metamask wallet Although the introduction says Web3 content aggregation platform it doesnt seem to support onchain data retrieval yet so Im still looking forward to them becoming a Web3 onestop search engine
There seems to be a plan to issue NFTs in the future which is considered a crossborder product

7Notion AI
NotionHQs builtin AI function can help users automatically organize notes correct typos list article highlights translate create tables etc
Suitable for scenarios such as copywriting studying etc
There are free trials and the subscription costs 10month
nn_summary: The user is using the Notion AI platform for their personal project and is satisfied with the results. They are considering upgrading to the Notion AI platform for their business.

Text:
Hi I believe Ive exhausted all the existing help articles on this
Im having a hard time with something that should be very basic I have 25 or so screens the ONLY interaction between them is that the user should be able to click andor press the arrow key to navigate LINEARLY between them
Sometimes it works especially if I go slowly it works every time But sometimes it doesnt sometimes it inexplicably jumps through sections pretty much only happens if I press the arrow keys quickly It appears that if I click through it goes linearly every time without skipping screens So the problem is only with the arrow keys which I cant disable so I need to understand the behavior before handing off to my client
Ive adjusted all the artboards The desired order is Row 1 Left to Right Row 2 Left to Right as described in the documentation All rows have the exact same Y coordinate All columns have the exact same X coordinate
Ive spent hours on this already and this is really basic behavior so Im not sure why its so hard I want it to act like powerpoint in presentation mode
Any help is appreciated I cant really share the prototype because Im on NDA
Or up vote the solution here
 
 
 
 Remove auto creating flow starting points Share an idea
 
 
 I love the new feature that allows multiple prototypes per page One issue Im having with it is it assumes I want everything to be a new flow starting point each time I dont link something from the first flow starting page 
It has a very linear mindset When I workprototype I tend to work on a section then link it back and that creates many flow starting points on accident and I have to delete them 
Itd be nice if either  it only created the first one and doesnt assume you want many o
nn_summary: User is having trouble with a basic feature in Figma, where clicking and/or pressing the arrow keys to navigate linearly between screens works sometimes and not others. They have adjusted all artboards and the desired order is Row 1 Left to Right, Row 2 Left to Right, but the issue persists. The user is concerned about the linear mindset of the feature, as it creates many flow starting points accidentally and needs to be adjusted.

Text:
Up your gradient game 
Learn how to create this folded gradient effect with figma in just a few easy steps  no plugins needed
Ready Lets dive in 
sponsored 
Step 1
Create a new artboard and add a rectangle with a grey fill 
Step 2 
Go into vector edit mode and select 2 anchor points Manipulate those till you get an angle you like 
Step 3 
Repeat the first 2 steps and make sure to connect each begin of a fold with the end points of the previous one 
Step 4
Finish your composition make sure to create artboard copies for different iterations 
Step 5 
Time for some color Create a linear gradient going from light to dark and copy amp paste the style to your vectors OPTCMDC gt OPTCMDV 
Tip Use more than 2 color stops in your gradient for a unique look 
Step 6 
Nice Now we just have to change the gradient angles for every other vector to create more realistic lighting 
Step 7 
To take your gradient fold to the next level introduce some extra color combinations 
Bonus Step 
You can try to go for a top and bottom gradient effect as shown below 
Okay one more bonus step 
You can even try to split up a larger gradient in multiple stops to create an effect like shown below 
No matter what you do make sure to experiment and have fun 
Are you trying out this technique Make sure to share it by tagging figma and FonsMans See you at the next one
 Follow me FonsMans for more
 LikeRetweet this thread so more people can see it

Text:
I have created a Creative Hack workshop template which I use to help teams and clients come up with ideas 
Ill also use Miro for other team tasks in which multiple people need to make inputs 
Its helpful for capturing a large amount of information in a little amount time and ultimately making sense of those inputs
I describe Miro as an Adobe Illustrator Group Chat I love the drag and drop flexibility of it and ease of use which allows me to capture ideas and feedback in real time Even when Im working with large groups of people the tool enables me to synthesize conversations and sharebacks in a way that captures the essence of a meeting
I have a few small feedback options for Miro 
 
1 For some reason I am forced to put a password on a board when I make it publically editable It didnt used to be like this and I find it annoying that I have to do that every time I end up just saying miroboard for everything 
 
2 When I invite outside of my org participants to join a board Via the UX they often think they have to sign up to view the board which leads to time lost in the session correcting them and getting them to the board as a guest quickly 
 
3 Not sure if this is still the case but I wish I could give people outside of my team permission to lock objects I work across teams so sometimes Im unable to lock assets on colleagues boards and vice versa

Text:
Hi Im new to Figma and im currently struggling with this trouble
So Im trying to recreate the wwwpandaexpresscom website and im with the banner part
 
 
 
 
 
My steps are
Create the base structure
Group it
Duplicate it
Adjust the circle and image for second asset
Make it interactive from prototype tab
Create a component set
On the Design Frame i add the component and it went crazy with the line that dragged into the previous asset frame And when i present it none of my clicks works with the banner Ive cross checked the prototyped and Ive selected the on click
Can anyone please correct me on which step did I do wrong
Thankyou
Only link the two variants together within the component Dont also link the component or any of its variants to the instance of that component
Another thing might be the way you created the component Id make the two states first then make them both components then select them both and click Combine as variants in the right panel then prototype the variants together within the component

nn_summary: A user was struggling with creating an interactive banner in Figma while recreating the Panda Express website. Its a highly collaborative tool that doesnt feel formal its not a deck but can be used to communicate the same information and there are lots of fun stickers to spice up casual work sessions
Its awesome that FigJam is built in with Figma and its so highly collaborative No need for a separate ecosystem 
 
Love these product features timer spotlighting users to see their view of the screen stickers autoalign tools and guides variety of community templates available
Mindmaps are more difficult compared to competitors ie Miro Its difficult to connect words into a cohesive web 
 
When mood boarding and importing a bunch of images it doesnt autoresize photos into a neat masonry layout with consistent sizing like competitors ie Pinterest and InVision 
 
Even though FigJam isnt for video calling because its so collaborative I wish there was a chat feature like other online video call apps
nn_summary: Users appreciate FigJam's integration with Figma, its collaborative nature, and features like timers, spotlighting, stickers, auto-align tools, and community templates. However, they find mindmaps more challenging compared to competitors and wish for improvements in image resizing and a chat feature for better collaboration.

Making everything visual and allowing connection points helps team members see the larger picture Having the ability to create highlevel roadmaps helps to understand the strategy Other tech options MS Whiteboard Excel etc are available today but are not nearly as effective
I truly enjoy the collaborative nature of Miro The fact that everyone on my team can hop on and add content is super helpful It allows me to understand better where people are coming from and lets me draw literally correlations between ideas
One downside of using Miro is the licensing aspect It would be great if there were a way to have a less expensive licensed option for business that doesnt allow for all of the bells and whistles Many team members for example will stick to creating stickies and emojis and never use any templates or more advanced features

Text: This review is more about Notion itself than the app After reviewing a bunch of other programs I subscribed to Notion to help build my new businesses internal infrastructure I was happy at first but it seems that the moment anything goes wrong Notion support is less than helpful Ive been going back and forth with Notion support trying to fix some billing issues updating my payment details Notion seems fairly incapable of actually troubleshooting the problem and at this point as I keep getting the same suggestions from different people Im convinced Notion help is running on AI and not an actual human with problem solving skills Despite numerous occasions saying the system wont let me update my payment details and suggesting an actual bug that may be causing the issues their reply was Its so easy you dont even have to log in Please update your information with this link Also to note you only get a reply every 24 hours so after every its so simple update your info communication gets a bit tiresome If youve seen Shs creek this whole exchange was the equivalent of just fold in the cheese  what do you mean  its easy you just fold in the cheese Ive tried to escalate this to a dept manager or someone in tech that would hopefully have the skills beyond its so easy just update your information however the more frustrated I get the less inclined they seem to be to help me Its at the point where Im considering switching to another service which will be a hard decision seeing as we have put a lot of time into building our systems in Notion Also to note despite being told that the old payment info is incorrect and I cannot update my payment details they continue to attempt to bill the old card number and then send me warnings that I need to update my information So let this be a cautionary tale for anyone using Notion for their business  its good until its not At which point you better be able to problem solve on your own Just fold in the cheese
nn_summary: User is frustrated with Notion support, as they are unable to update their payment details and are being billed for the old card number. They are considering switching to another service due to the time and effort they have invested in building their internal infrastructure in Notion.

Text:
How to turn an almost perfect UIUX to perfect
Using  as a perfect example created by cnnr_cllhn 
cnnr_cllhn LoseTheVery is a fantastic tool that finds a more concise adjective without using very Example very rich  affluent
The core idea is simple and the UI was chosen to reflect that Its straight to the point just like the Google Search homepage So whats the problem 
cnnr_cllhn  There are 3 main flaws
1 Site feels messy
2 Design lacks consistency
3 Elements feel a little too cramped
Well approach it via negativa style by removing stuff rather than adding
 Lets work on that that using figma
cnnr_cllhn figma 1 Decluttering 
The most important step would be to remove the clutter  the annoying newsletter popup the newsletter section and the newsletter banner Well get back to it later
This has already made a difference The interface looks significantly cleaner 
cnnr_cllhn figma 2 Let the design breathe 
Lets add more whitespace  the more the better This will achieve a better visual separation
Now the very  x  y line instantly grabs our attention 
cnnr_cllhn figma 3 Making buttons prettier 
Buttons look chaotic here randomly spaced different padding etc
Lets increase the font size adjust the padding and replace the word random with a dice icon Well also invert the third button
The buttons now look modern and consistent 
cnnr_cllhn figma 4 Typography 
The typography is a mess 4 diffrent typefaces on one page Lets reduce our typeface choices to just 2 Well leave the sans font but lets choose a different serif font
I would choose a humanist style serif Lets go with Crimson Pro

Im not saying this has actually happened yet still looking into it but beware when installing Wordpress plugins for AI products like ChatGPT  I installed a whole heap of plugins to see where they were at and then didnt use them for a month and this morning I got an email 
Received at 355am my time I was asleep and the email says it is triggered by usage limit I havent been using it 
Also I have been recovering from surgery and these usage records show usage that I am 100 certain didnt come from me because I installed those plugins prior to April 3 and the keys show last usage of 19 April Have obviously revoked
wordfence I think this might be for  
To clarify these are not plugins written by GPT but Repository plugins that offer AI writing assistance I wanted to test them out for something I am working on but it looks like one has gone rogue since 14 April
The only other thing I can think of is that NotionHQ might be doing API calls but I highly doubt That is the only thing I have installed on my machine but I havent connected with Make etc yet Anyway just a heads up to everyone to be very careful with these things  scammers

Conversations around open source in design  Im curious if this would this improve involvement of designers in open source Indulge me
Having a design system where standards are defined and designers can jointly contribute components
These components would be based on the core styling of that design system 
This would also include improvements to accessibility guidelines and improvements in documentation
In turn anyone can use these components either as they are or make slight adjustments
I think figma already has a foundation to enable this  however it needs to be defined
Having an actively maintained DS in the public domain Not tied to any organization
Anyone can pick it up and suggest improvements
dnaijatechguy figma Were seeing more open source design related projects be shared using penpotapp DS in particular Also some contributions here follow that mindset
nn_summary: User is curious about the potential impact of open source design on designers' involvement in open source. They also mention the possibility of an actively maintained design system in the public domain, which anyone can use and contribute to.

Text:
Miro helps us have one place for designs significant milestones and team collaboration It enables work globally and a quicker location to go back and find previous decisions and collaborations
Visual data sharing It is a great place to put pictures and ideas and map processes It is like having a visual management board in the traditional war room but digital so anyone can access it and it is saved Being able to use templates is also huge for getting teams started
It does not integrate well with some apps or display items Tables are still not ideal and it is often better to work in excel and copypaste your data into Miro Scaling can also be a little clunky where it can be harder to keep things visible at a high enough level but also readable when sharing sections 
 
The menus and controls are also not super intuitive It definitely takes time to bring new members up to speed
nn_summary: The user loves Figma for its ease of use and plugins for UI design, as it helps them develop software and websites. They appreciate the software's ability to create UI designs for iOS and Android Apps, but wish it had Photoshop-like options for creating things.

Text:
I need a fast easy and collaborative way to wireframe and fatmarker sketch ideas with my design and engineering team We also use it for retrospective meeting whiteboards
I love that Figjam is in the Figma suite and is so simple and easy to use As a Product Manager I am not adept enough at Figma to use it as a whiteboard so I use Figjam to mock up ideas and do light wireframing before turning ideas into designs in full Figma
Figjams strength is also its weakness it is very simple and lacks some other whiteboard features found in competing whiteboard products like Miro If they continue adding features I think that Figjam will be a market leader soon

Text:
Notion would be amazing if if it was easy to do easy things There is a lot of functionality that would make your life a lot easier What takes away from all of this potential is a buggy and nagging experience trying to input information
Trying to add a todo list checkbox  click the Hamburger menu with your finger iPad list comes up click To Do List menu goes away to do list item doesnt populate Try using touchpad follow the same steps to do list doesnt populate
Create a bullet point and click the hamburger menu change to to do list to do list doesnt populate
You are also able to do slash commands So I press  I see the menu open and it closes immediately The to do list is only an example There are endless nagging bugs like this throughout the experience So instead of being able to use the app to enhance workflows and life in general you are constantly fighting the app
I stopped using Notion for about 8 months and used a number of other products Because of all the data in notion and all of the things I had set up already I came back to because SURELY they had fixed the bugs Its the exact same No more consistent or stable than it was 8 months ago
What is really annoying to me is that they release new features New and shiny things like their AI tool I WOULD RATHER HAVE AN APP THAT WORKS PROPERLY and not have AI I dont care about AI I just want to be able to input data If that works AI would be amazing
It will be long and arduous but im moving to ClickUp

Text:
Autolayout with hug content on width or height should resize to zero or whatever the applied padding is when all content is hidden Now when all contents are hidden it remains as the dimensions of the last visible item it had Anyone have a workaround or know if there is a way to avoid this bug
I am also experiencing this The container with auto layout has its height set to Hug contents with no vertical spacing and no vertical padding and child element heights are also Hug contents
However the issue seems to be from what occurs when you hide layers because their height automatically changes to Fixed BUT even just deleting the layers at once still leaves the container at its previous height despite still being set to Hug contents
Somethings up with this
nn_summary: Users are experiencing an issue with Figma's auto layout feature, where the container does not resize to zero when all content is hidden. The problem seems to be related to hidden layers having their height automatically changed to "Fixed." Users are seeking a workaround or solution to this bug.

Text:
I really love nested instance properties feature but it works for one component instance only It would be useful if nested instance properties were available when I select several parent instances
My example
Component structure
component Label  used for different statuses  has text property Label for text inside 2 component Table Cell  used for building tables  has variants for different types of cells
Case I create column of statuses in the table it includes cells which include label If I want to update text in one label I can use nested labels text property But when I want to update text in several cells nested instance property disappears and I need to select label instead of cells or use some plugin for bulk text update
PS thanks to figma team for your incredible work I would also love to see support for this
nn_summary: Users appreciate the "nested instance properties" feature in Figma but wish it could be applied to multiple parent instances simultaneously. Text:
Miro is easy to use and has key features that assist in my diagramming The template I use counts the number of items within a cell and this helps me identify when Im assigning too many tasks to a given week
Miro has several templates and features that make it unique This diversity supports different uses and I can both manage projects and gather feedback through other assets
It lacks integration with other services eg Notion and it also lacks screen reading capabilities for visual accessibility The lack of accessibility is the one thing keeping my organization from using it more widespread
nn_summary: Users find Miro easy to use with helpful features for diagramming and appreciate its diverse templates that support various use cases, including project management and feedback gathering. However, they mention the lack of integration with other services like Notion and the absence of screen reading capabilities for visual accessibility, which prevents their organization from adopting it more widely.

Text:
Ive been working on this project but while making the dropdown menu I ran into an issue
It seems like when the dropdown menu opens it is good but when I tried to do the prototyping to close it I ran into some issues
Here is what i did
Screenshot 202305PHONE_NUMBER231 321 KB
Everything seemed good but when I tried to preview it it would keep opening and closing rapidly as I moved my mouse over the selected navigation title Shop
Here is the link to the file 
Thanks for the help guys
Hi there
So I guess whats happening is that the prototype gets stuck between a situation where its opening an overlay because the mouse is on Shop and also closing the overlay because if the mouse has left Shop then it should close This is why it seems to flicker To fix this Id recommend using interactive components instead of the Overlay feature An example of what Im talking about is in the community file
Hope this helps
Hey Gayani
This helped a lot with the issue but it started another one  So now the issue is that the dropdown now will not close after the mouse is off of it and the navigation title moves up with the dropdown making it disappear from the screen I copied pretty much everything from the figma file you sent me and tried to fix it but couldnt find a solution
image1528235 55 KB
nn_summary: User faced an issue with a dropdown menu in Figma, where it rapidly opened and closed during preview. Another user suggested that the issue might be due to the prototype getting stuck between opening and closing the overlay, and recommended using interactive components instead of the Overlay feature to fix the problem.

Text:
It has a larger workspace than what I typically use in Microsoft Powerpoint Allows for a much larger workspace to create in and can shift easily between different sections
Miro provides a great whiteboarding experience for our teams as they work together with others in a virtual strategic planning environment I love that we can set up custom boards or pull in examples from others as well and modify them to meet our needs There are a lot of great features that I still need to explore to make sure Im getting the most of out of this tool
I still feel like there is a lot to learn about how best to use this system Ive sat through a few trainings but its not always easy to know how to use the various features within the tool and how to help others take advantage of these features The connection to our agency planning platform works but always requires us to log in before we can access within that system Because the Miro access shuts off after just a few hours it requires me to log in frequently to make sure it continues to work successfully in our system as Im setting up a session or trying to work on sessions with others It would be great if we could log in once and have it work consistently if Im on the same computer or at least be good for 24 hours of access
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's large workspace and whiteboarding capabilities for virtual strategic planning. However, they find it challenging to learn and utilize all the features and face frequent login issues when connecting to their agency planning platform. They suggest improving the login process for better user experience

postponing to build
were diving right into building

instead of actually getting started to build

I was a longtime lurker before that following makers on Twitter and ProductHunt always reading and overthinking but never building 
They call this analysis paralysis
and its pretty annoying isnt it
ProductHunt Thats why we already made some of these choices for you for the bootcamp to get you into the action asap 
No need to compare and analyse everything first just follow along to get started 
Because youll learn the most from actually using the NoCode tools

After learning how to use these youll be able to  Build a web app
 Build a mobile app

 Keep track of your projects
 Connect tools together
 And automate your work
All without writing code 
Adalo AdaloHQ
Design and build custom web amp mobile applications without code

Store and present your data easily
connect it to other tools and build apps on top

to keep track of all your NoCode projects

Text:
FigJam fills the role of a handful of tools we were previously using across the business We were able to consolidate and say this is the true approved tool across the company Its helped teams align and ensure access across the company via single sign on The access issues we had previously with InVisionFreehand Miro etc are long gone No more requesting to view or edit access
Anyone can get in there and start using it Its pretty intuitive and we use it all the time across many teams to collaborate brainstorm plan whiteboard etc We also switched to using FigJam for all team retros in the company All the templates timer stickers music and more make FigJam fun to use  but not in a way that distracts from the work
I dont dislike the tool at all I will say one pain point we ran into is that there currently isnt a way to use stickies while maintaining anonymity Anyone can go click an icon to toggle the original authors name off and on to see who said it  not ideal for retros BUT our account rep taught us to switch to shapes and we no longer have this problem Would be nice to have a retro setting on a FigJam that would preserve the psychological safety of team members We feel extremely supported by our awesome account rep
nn_summary: Users appreciate FigJam for consolidating multiple tools, improving access across the company, and being intuitive for collaboration and brainstorming. They enjoy the templates, timer, stickers, and music features. However, they suggest adding an anonymity feature for stickies to maintain psychological safety during retrospectives.

They also like the single sign-on option and the ability to upload real-life sticky notes as Miro stickies. However, some users face frustrations with company-imposed restrictions on access and board deletion.

Text:
When working remote as a product manager it can be tricky to get everyone on the same page FigJam allows everyone to share a single space and it truly feels like youre in the room together I have used it in situations as the sole driver while sharing my screen with the team to get a quick diagram or mind map put together and I have also used it collaboratively with my team as a digital whiteboard You can bring people into FigJam and have them collaborating within minutes whether they are familiar with the tech or not
Being able to join with several colleagues throw together a quick brainstorm and work quickly has been great I have used FigJam professionally to lay out calendar schedules run retros and run client workshops It is even valuable to go back to your data and organize everything into a visually consumable map This is a personal note but I even used FigJam with my wife who at the time was on a job away from our home to lay out our entire wedding floor plan and seating chart
The templates can feel a little daunting I often cant find exactly what I wanted or was looking for but usually a quick search online or asking colleagues leads me to finding a better template That or I just go through and make my own layout because its just that easy
nn_summary: Users find Miro helpful for facilitating and documenting collaboration across their team, particularly in remote settings. However, some users find the tool difficult to use and believe it's best suited for real-time collaboration.

Can anyone please correct me on which step did I do wrong
Thankyou
Only link the two variants together within the component Dont also link the component or any of its variants to the instance of that component
Another thing might be the way you created the component Id make the two states first then make them both components then select them both and click Combine as variants in the right panel then prototype the variants together within the component
this solve my problem  thankyou very much

Text:
Our team uses FigJam to both collect and organize data when planning product updates and we also use it to visually map out user workflows This lets us demo the experience internally while taking realtime notes that can be shared with the whole team
For UX design and team collaboration in a remote work environment FigJam is an excellent way to design product workflows and collaborate with various team members The controls are intuitive and its easy to track comments and changes
I dont have any negative comments about FigJam as my experience has been nothing but positive Its allowed me as a Product Marketer to collaborate effectively with both designers and engineers
nn_summary: The user appreciates the colorful board, sticky, and other features that keep people busy and interactive, as well as the ability to interact on the same board for clarity and interactivity. They also suggest adding timers for specific sticky or date-based boards.

nn_summary: Users find FigJam valuable for remote collaboration, as it enables 'whiteboarding' without being in the same room. Were a hybrid company and working in Product we often need to have collaborative sessions across teams where some members are remote and some are in person This is by far the best replacement for oldfashioned inperson whiteboarding with sticky notes and its even better because you can save it and easily access it later
Its been conducive to facilitating collaboration on designs whiteboarding brainstorming process reviews and strategy sessions Figjams design makes it easy to use for a wide variety of scenarios Weve used it asynchronously to prep for a discussion as well as simultaneously inmeeting as a way to accomplish inperson whiteboardingtype conversations especially when some participants are remote
The UI took a little getting used to and there was a short learning curve to figure out how to access different elements and add them to the page

FigJam makes collaboration really easy when conducting remote whiteboarding sessions and allows our team to visually document and easily share useful information

I think having some more visual options out of the box could be nice making it easier to create a file that looks super customized visually exciting and aligned with our brand ID

Text:
Dear NotionHQ
I recently obtained my certification from your platform and while I appreciate the knowledge and skills I gained from the experience I believe its time for a change in your testing methods
NotionHQ Were in 2023 and your current questionandanswer format feels outdated With the vast resources available to us online including Google Notion docs and ChatGPT its unnecessary to rely solely on memorization and rote learning
NotionHQ I suggest implementing a challenge or projectbased approach to make the tests more engaging and interesting Spending an hour answering questions only to fall short of the 70 passing mark feels like a waste of time and time is a valuable commodity for everyone
NotionHQ I understand that obtaining a certification is important but the current system doesnt seem to reflect the dynamic and innovative nature of your platform I hope youll consider updating your testing methods to keep up with the times

Text:
Notion is an absolutely fantastic app for projects notes sorting and many many more due to its versatility and freedom As a single person notion is completely free with next to no restrictions Teams will require payment but it has a free trial to see how you like it and I consider it fantastic for groups However that being said mobile notion is severely lacking in certain features that the desktop version has Basic features like renaming your workspace can only be done on desktop There are also some bugs with the ui like the back arrow sometimes just straight up sending me out of the current workspace and the toolbar disappearing and requiring me to restart the app
These dont ruin the app by any means as notion is still an amazing app and is still amazing in mobile but I would consider mobile notion a great ADDITION to your desktop notion Use desktop as your main form of using notion when creating and use mobile when youre away from the desktop or need to check something Mobile as your only form of using notion isnt terrible but its definitely inferior
Notion overall is an amazing app with amazing developers who deserve lots of love and support They also gave major generosity with the app of which many other services wouldve charged the individual a large amount of money to use what notion gives for free which again is pretty much everything except very minor things like upload file size limits
nn_summary: User praises Notion for its versatility and freedom, but notes that mobile version lacks certain features and has bugs. They suggest using desktop as the main form of using Notion, and mobile as an addition to it.

Text:
Continuing the discussion from Dynamic number of nested component instances
I have components that might include a number of instances of another component eg rows or columns in a table options in a selectdropdown etc To accomplish this I have to either create a separate variant for each potential number of nested instances or create the component with the maximum possible number of nested instances and make the instances hideable Neither is optimalthe first could lead to a crazy number of variants and the second could result in a large number of hidden layers which hits performance pretty hard
It would be great to be able to specify a component instance to be nested in a parent component then allow an arbitrary number of the nested child instances in instances of the parent component
nn_summary: User discovered a way to transform individual elements in Figma by selecting multiple objects and changing their pixel size in the right panel, similar to Illustrator's "transform each" option.

Text:
Lack of visual communication Traditional communication methods like emails or chats can sometimes make it difficult to convey complex ideas or visualize a concept FigJam solves this problem by providing an easytouse whiteboarding tool that allows teams to quickly create visual representations of their ideas and share them with others
FigJam is a collaborative online whiteboarding tool created by Figma that allows teams to work together in realtime to brainstorm plan and visualize ideas One of the best things about FigJam is its ease of use and intuitive interface which makes it simple for even nondesigners to quickly create diagrams flowcharts wireframes and other types of visual content
sometimes UI could be complicated if youre a user that are not familiar with the FIGMA infinite canvas system that you can scroll a lot and not find the end Aside from that is great
nn_summary: User enjoys using Figma for brainstorming and continuing discussions on the same virtual whiteboard, but finds it heavy to use, causing issues for participants with weak network connections.

Text:
Before Figma I had a hard time meeting up with customer requirements for Prototyping and Wireframing of mobile apps and web landing pages I was using Photoshop and it was quite tasking With Figma my designs are easier I complete them faster and I have access to more methods specifically meant for UIUX
It is not as restrictive as other design applications It is very free easy incorporation of external files that contribute to the general design and an interface that even a beginner can get around with ease
Requires a fast internet connection and saves all your work to the cloud so a stable internet connection is a must while working Cloud storage is an appreciable feature but offline functionality is a musthave feature as well
nn_summary: Users find Figma helpful for prototyping and wireframing mobile apps and web landing pages, as it is less restrictive and easier to use than other design applications like Photoshop. However, they mention that it requires a fast and stable internet connection, as all work is saved to the cloud, suggesting that offline functionality would be a valuable addition.

gave me 10 things to do it worked
big fan of AI as personal coach no more reading airport books just a few bullet points w minimal filler
2 the list was
 declutter your environment
 prioritize your tasks
 set clear goals  limit screen time
 learn to say no
 automate and delegate
 cultivate a minimalist mindset
 simplify your finances
 create routines
 practice mindfulness
3 i ported this list into NotionHQ and then used their embedded AI feature to expand each list item into practical steps with examples
i then made daily action items to help me actually do these things every day
and then i blocked time on my calendar to do the action items

Text:
Flexible platform for remote teams to work together on a visual level
As a user of FigJam I absolutely love the collaborative features of this tool Its so easy to share my FigJam boards with team members and work together in realtime no matter where we are located The interface is also really intuitive and userfriendly which makes it easy to get started with minimal training Another thing I love about FigJam is its versatility  I can use it for everything from brainstorming ideas to creating wireframes and user flows
It doesnt offer as many advanced design features as some other design tools on the market While its great for brainstorming and creating quick sketches or diagrams it may not be the best choice for more complex design work
nn_summary: Users prefer Miro over PowerPoint and virtual whiteboards due to its unrestricted format and ability to add extensive information. They find it particularly useful for project discovery, creating diagrams, and mindmaps. However, they struggle with formatting diagrams and find templates difficult to adapt.

Text:
Ive been working on this project but while making the dropdown menu I ran into an issue
It seems like when the dropdown menu opens it is good but when I tried to do the prototyping to close it I ran into some issues
Here is what i did
Screenshot 202305PHONE_NUMBER231 321 KB
Everything seemed good but when I tried to preview it it would keep opening and closing rapidly as I moved my mouse over the selected navigation title Shop
Here is the link to the file 
Thanks for the help guys
Hi there
So I guess whats happening is that the prototype gets stuck between a situation where its opening an overlay because the mouse is on Shop and also closing the overlay because if the mouse has left Shop then it should close This is why it seems to flicker To fix this Id recommend using interactive components instead of the Overlay feature An example of what Im talking about is in the community file
Hope this helps
Hey Gayani
This helped a lot with the issue but it started another one  So now the issue is that the dropdown now will not close after the mouse is off of it and the navigation title moves up with the dropdown making it disappear from the screen I copied pretty much everything from the figma file you sent me and tried to fix it but couldnt find a solution
image1528235 55 KB
nn_summary: User faced issues with a dropdown menu in Figma, causing it to open and close rapidly during prototyping. They tried a suggested solution using interactive components, which resolved the initial problem but led to a new issue where the dropdown wouldn't close and the navigation title moved up with the dropdown, making it disappear from the screen.

This app worked fine as a free user however after becoming a subscribed member I ran into some annoying and suspicious issues I wanted to utilize the AI to see where the limits were and then to eventually use it for academic and creative purposes Of course theres a limit to free uses so I subscribed to a month to see how often I would have to use this and if it was really worth paying for longer I paid 499 for the one month subscription but it wont actually let me use the AI and instead tells me that I need to subscribe but I already have The receipt is in my email as proof that I did pay

Text:
When we need a meeting we always decide to use Miro And this is a standard in our way of working even if we are all in the same room The reason is that Miro has been instrumental in brainstorming until we reach agreements that we all like The methodology has made the meetings less timeconsuming and more effective
The fluidity of the application is out of this world Thanks to it we can create structures while meeting without waiting for changes In addition its easy to use so anyone can master it and get a lot out of it to express their ideas
Miro works perfectly thanks to the fact that it is online but this is a drawback if the connection is unstable Therefore I would like some measures so that the unstable connection does not affect the experience so much

Text:
i know this has been posted before but Figma really needs to address this issue pasting an email address should not just format the existing text as a link with the new text as a destination when creating prototypes with lots of dummy accounts or even with real data copying and pasting lots of emails becomes the hardest part of my day and there are no key shortcuts either i have to copy then right click paste to replace or copy as text its obnoxious and frankly i dont think anyone using Figma has ever needed a functional email link for a prototype its not like were creating live products where someone might actually click the email link to send an email
please fix this Figma its infuriating and breaks the flow of creating prototypes When basically every prototype i create for work requires a list of users and their contact information it becomes a daily problem which destroys efficiency at the very least allow us to paste them without formatting using cmdshiftV or something
10000 for me too This is honestly driving me insane guys Please just give us an option to paste without formatting or perhaps stick it in the preferences to turn off hyperlinks on paste Theyre not necessary
nn_summary: Users are frustrated with Figma's automatic formatting of pasted email addresses as links, which disrupts their workflow when creating prototypes with multiple email addresses. They request an option to paste without formatting or disable hyperlinks on paste for improved efficiency.

Text:
Miro has the power to aggregate what has been shared among multiple tools In addition it has the potential to allow multiple people to work at the same time without any problems and it has been used in seminars and training sessions and has been very popular In the training that I participate in training using miro is increasing and it is very useful to visualize the result of the discussion in a short time
Miro is easier to use than an actual whiteboard In particular its easy to attach write move and connect sticky notes and it automatically corrects the connection lines so you can use it more efficiently than an actual whiteboard So you can focus on the discussion Also miro is great for sharing information you create online ensuring that the same image information is conveyed As a comparison to other similar tools its nice to have reaction features icons and formatting that you cant use up
The disadvantage of miro is that the access can be quite slow depending on the board When you first open a board with a lot of information on it you often have to wait a few 10 seconds I hope that this problem will be solved by devising means such as image processing centered on the area where the display priority is being determined Also if you just use it you dont have a chance to see new or useful functions so I think it would be good if you were shown it by a popup This feature may already exist and you may have turned it off yourself but it is true that it does not appear at this time
nn_summary: The user appreciates Miro's versatility, comparing it to a whiteboard that is easy for everyone to use, with features like screenshots repositories, markups, user flows, and progress boards. However, they find organizing boards within their organization challenging, often losing track of specific Miro boards

Text:
How to turn an almost perfect UIUX to perfect
Using  as a perfect example created by cnnr_cllhn 
cnnr_cllhn LoseTheVery is a fantastic tool that finds a more concise adjective without using very Example very rich  affluent
The core idea is simple and the UI was chosen to reflect that Its straight to the point just like the Google Search homepage So whats the problem 
cnnr_cllhn  There are 3 main flaws
1 Site feels messy
2 Design lacks consistency
3 Elements feel a little too cramped
Well approach it via negativa style by removing stuff rather than adding
 Lets work on that that using figma
cnnr_cllhn figma 1 Decluttering 
The most important step would be to remove the clutter  the annoying newsletter popup the newsletter section and the newsletter banner Well get back to it later
This has already made a difference The interface looks significantly cleaner 
cnnr_cllhn figma 2 Let the design breathe 
Lets add more whitespace  the more the better This will achieve a better visual separation
Now the very  x  y line instantly grabs our attention
nn_summary: A user discussed how to improve an "almost perfect" UI/UX using LoseTheVery as an example, pointing out three main flaws: messiness, lack of design consistency, and cramped elements. They suggested decluttering the interface by removing unnecessary elements like the newsletter popup, section, and banner, and noted that this made the interface look cleaner. They used Figma to work on these improvements.

Text:
I use it for several things private documents to guide my thinking and notes collaborative whiteboards sharing diagrams with colleagues and documentation
As far as Im aware Miro is unique in its ability to enable a user to rapidly build diagrams in realtime while other users observe or contribute simultaneously I can create flow charts and diagrams so quickly And its easy to make the results look great
The tables feature is lackluster but its still an experiment Other than that the licensing model has been slightly annoying to deal with If I want a colleague to contribute to a board they need a full license even if they use it for 30 minutes and never use it again This arrangement doesnt feel optimal from a fairness and value pointofview but I still find the tool to be worth the money
nn_summary: The user finds Miro unique in its ability to enable rapid diagram creation in real-time, while others can observe or contribute. They appreciate the ease of use and the ability to create great-looking diagrams. However, they find the licensing model to be slightly annoying and would prefer a more fair and value-oriented arrangement.

Text:
It solves the same problem as other whiteboard app does The fact it comes as part of Figma is a huge plus I might consider using something else if it was a big addon or wasnt part of the main platform There are better apps but the fact that this baked ina s part of Figma is the biggest reason I use it Its great that it allows me to quickly spin up a board and hammer out visual concepts quickly and Id happily use this to create UR artifacts but it has some drawbacks and I wouldnt be able to facilitate some activities
Figjam is a great tool that fulfills a lot of the functionality you get in more advanced whiteboard apps and does more or less a good job of it The ability to deeplink to elements in a board and make sections and postits is fine and works pretty well
There could be more functionality to format and resize postits Itd also be really helpful for the facilitation of workshop activities to be able to show and hide sections this would ideally be on a user or for users or user groups More mechanics like this which allows groups of participants and facilitators to work together would have a positive impact on running workshop activity withing the Figma platform and in FigJam

Text:
Miro allows our distributed workforce to collaborate in realtime and keep an effective shared workspace that they can return to and use to continue developing ideas and opportunities Also the ability to adapt to the needs of each meeting and workshop are incredibly valuable
The collaboration element of the board The ongoing development and new features Miro continues to release The diversity of exercises or workshops that can be hosted in Miro The ability to enable hybrid or fully remote teams to collaborate effectively
For people who have not yet used an online whiteboarding tool the navigation and basic features might take a bit of getting used to However this can be overcome with some basic training or youtube videos
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's continuous development of new features, such as tags, sentiment-based clusters, and Miro AI, which help in organizing qualitative data for UX researchers. They enjoy the simple and intuitive interface, allowing for easy creation and organization of data from workshops. However, limitations in typography options hinder users from creating presentations that align with their company's identity, causing them to switch to other platforms.

Text:
How might we collaborate efficiently in a hybrid work environment 
 
Workshopping within miro means people can participate in workshops remotely regardless of where they are in the planet This has also meant that travelling for workshops has become less important  saving the business money
Obviously the pandemic force a lot of us to find new ways to collaborate and connect without being face to face Miro was clearly ahead of the game in this regard But even since were seeing more of each other in the flesh miro still seems to be adding value with how easy it ease to document workshops quickly capture ideas and bring people together to brainstorm
There are very few things to dislike about miro There are some very minor things like how tables not being incredibly userfriendly limitations in how you can modify shapes particularly for the sake of creating wireframes But all in all this stuff is nice to have and the fact that you can even do basic wire framing along side everything else that you can do is a win
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's ability to align remote meeting participants and create engaging, self-documenting workshops. The speed and fluidity of the application enhance the facilitator experience. However, the licensing model and board structure can be confusing for infrequent collaborators, and users suggest improving security by including the entire enterprise as users and charging only for power users.

Text:
1 It would be easier for all native Spanish speakers to use and understand By having the interface and content in our native language it would be easier for us to understand the application and use all its functions correctly
2 It would increase our efficiency at work By not having to constantly translate terms and concepts into Spanish it would save us time and allow us to be more efficient at work
3 We would feel more comfortable If Spanish is our main language it would be more comfortable for us to use the application in our native language
4 It would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in Spanish Using Notion in Spanish would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in our language which can be especially useful if we are working in a Spanishspeaking business environment
5 It would make us feel included and valued By having the option to use Notion in Spanish we feel included and valued as users of the application which would increase our satisfaction and loyalty to it
nn_summary: User suggests adding Spanish language support to Notion, as it would be easier for Spanish-speaking users to use and understand, increase efficiency at work, and make them feel more comfortable. They also suggest learning new technical and business terms in Spanish, which would be useful in a Spanish-speaking business environment.

Text:
I have a problem with the horizontal scroll of my prototype it works perfect only if I dont apply the dropshadow to the cards I cant figure out why can anyone help me
No dropshadow
With dropshadow
As you can see the link with dropshadow horizontal scroll works strange the initial position has a space and also the final
thank you
Raffaele_Parlato hey I also faced the same problem and hours of researching I found the issue Instead of applying dropshadow on every card individually but instead group the cards together and then applying it as a whole This should completely fix the problem
Raffaele_Parlato Im not exactly sure what the issue is here with the scrolling Im just guessing the system adds the shadow to the size of the cards but I also found another problem with this which is the shadows actually overlap on one another although it may not seem so I used the colorpicker to test but when you group them together the shadows are always at the bottom and do not go over other cards
nn_summary: Users faced issues with horizontal scrolling in Figma prototypes when applying dropshadow to individual cards. A suggested solution is to group the cards together and apply the dropshadow to the entire group, which also prevents shadow overlapping.

Text: This app worked fine as a free user however after becoming a subscribed member I ran into some annoying and suspicious issues I wanted to utilize the AI to see where the limits were and then to eventually use it for academic and creative purposes Of course theres a limit to free uses so I subscribed to a month to see how often I would have to use this and if it was really worth paying for longer I paid 499 for the one month subscription but it wont actually let me use the AI and instead tells me that I need to subscribe but I already have The receipt is in my email as proof that I did pay My app says I am a subscribed member so why is it denying me member benefits I have tried many things to fix this including restarting my phone restarting the app deleting and downloading the app again logging out and then back in etc Nothing has worked so far Not only do I feel robbed but it almost feels intentional because when I tried to use the AI before paying for a subscription I would only get a message saying that I have run out of free uses but after subscribing it sends me straight to the subscription choice page That gives the impression that the app is purposely not letting me use the AI program even though I have paid for it regardless of if that is actually the case or not Looking through some of the other lower reviews I am not the only one who has ran into this problem Please fix this because it is frustrating to not be able to use what I paid for Summary I paid for premium but the app isnt letting me actually use premium benefits Thank you Frustrated Notion User
nn_summary: User experienced issues with the app after subscribing, as it would not allow them to use the AI program. They tried various solutions, but none worked. They feel robbed and suspect intentional behavior on the app's part.

Though its slightly expensive applicationits really worth it

After just recently discovering NotionHQ Ive quickly realized this amazing tool can be used for basically ANYTHING 
So Ive made a list of the top 4 things I will personally be using Notion for and how
This is my 1st Thread Might suck but Ill get better at it 
As a Personal Knowledge Headquarters
Ill do this by
Creating a database of notes ideas and stuff I find
Using templates for organizing everything
Using tags and filters to find information quickly
Using linked databases to connect information
For Personal Productivity
Ill do this by
Creating a dashboard with my goals and progress
Using templates for journaling and personal lists
Using a database for todo lists and worklife schedule
Using linked databases for tracking finances fitness and reading
To Collaborate with Others
Ill do this by
Creating a database with tasks information and friends
Creating an organized area to find and share things
Using linked databases for tracking what we find
Using templates for notes and overall organization
For Travel Planning
Ill do this by Creating a database of destinations things to do and notes
Using linked databases to connect all related information
Using templates for itineraries lists and budget tracking
Using tags and filters to find everything quickly
Any new ideas  thoughts  and feedback is welcomed
Anyone else use NotionHQ for other things
Lemme Know

Text:
Helps to visually explain complex systems in a simple way Provides value to our consultancy
FigJams simplicity and ease of use enables fast mapping and sharing of complex systems and dependencies Ive recently created several sprawling figjam charts that outline marketing programs from beginning to end for our clients They have been so helpful keeping the team informed at a high level and are a great reference to regularly huddle around 
 
This is just one kind of use  because of its flexibility you can begin to discover ways to think and present ideas large or small Create fast design mockups review and provide feedback on designs create storyboards  the list can go on and on Easily shareable to anyone with little to no trouble with login attempts or dealing with incompatible file types 
 
It feels so freeing to break from the clunky confines of a ppt slide with its bad clip art and boring bullet points Expanding across an endless canvas allows us to combat any confusion or anxiety that tends to show up around building complex marketing campaigns 
 
Figjam has become one the most valuable tools in my arsenal and is one of the best Ive seen after almost 2 decades of working with these types of apps 
 
Highly recommended
Cant think of any at the moment I need to spend more time exploring all the templates to expand my usage

Text:
Hi all I am working on a Figma plugin that needs to import style from our team library Through research I think the way is to first use Figma REST API to get the keys of styles from our library file and the use figmaimportStyleByKeyAsync to import the style However the issue is this requires me to put my Access token in the plugin and I dont want to Is there a way for plugin to authenticate when making REST API calls on behalf of the person who uses the plugin
Or are there any other easier ways to importaccess styles from team library file in plugin Thanks a lot
You have several ways
Users will create their own personal access tokens which will be inserted into the input field of your plugin
Users will open the necessary library files run the plugin there to get the necessary keys return to another file to continue working
Hardcode the keys in the plugin
31 Or add these keys to for example a JSON file that you or anyone else can keep updating as needed

Hi thanks for the reply I see I will give option 3 a try to hard code the keys in the plugin and keep the plugin for internal use first The other ways seem to have some extra steps for people who uses plugin
nn_summary: Three ways to import/access styles from team library file in plugin are suggested: users creating personal access tokens, users opening library files, and hardcoding/updating keys in a JSON file.

Text:
After using the AI tool for a while I ran into some issues and also found some toolsplatforms suitable for lazy people
Lets read the conclusion first I recommend the poe_platform platform The supported bots are also quite rich There are no IP requirements and if you have advanced requirements you can directly subscribe on the Poe platform
ChatGPT 
Currently I mainly use Claudes robot on the Poe platform Heres a summary of the advantages Ive discovered
1 Responses will be faster than ChatGPT in Chinese conversations
2 The corpus will be updated in due course I dont know the frequency but at least he can help me sort out the relatively new content Layer2 and Starknet
3 Writing and copywriting skills seem to be stronger than ChatGPT subjective feeling
Lets take a look at other AI tool products in detail
1chatGPT
There are strict restrictions on IP and a global proxyprivacy window must be attached to it before it can be used
There are unstable situations For example I went to WeChat to send a message to him halfway through the conversation and when I came back I had to refresh the page before I could use it
There are occasional interruptions in answering so I need to remind him to continue
In the end he blocked me which is the biggest problem with using it so far 

2Google Bard Google fought back against OpenAIs products Currently I havent been able to experience them due to IP issues so I abandoned them according to the purpose of our lazy people According to feedback from some friends there is still a certain gap between product power and ChatGPT

3Claude
The founder is the former executive vice president of OpenAI This product is very popular in the investment community Its a bit like the capital that didnt invest in Tesla back then placed a heavy bet on Lucid
Its currently completely free to use and supports use of  on Poe and Slack
4Poe
This is an integrated platform made by Quora that supports mainstream AI conversation tools GPT4 and Claude paid subscriptions are also supported
Its the best toolplatform to use so far and you can use it without having to connect to a global agent or open a ladder

5BuddyGPT
This is a GPT robot on Telegram which will be more friendly to heavy TG users Theres a free version but it only supports 10 free messages per month and the subscription costs 599month

6Defalsh
Web3 content aggregation platform with GPT as the information processing engine
There is no need to register and you can use it with authorization through the Metamask wallet Although the introduction says Web3 content aggregation platform it doesnt seem to support onchain data retrieval yet so Im still looking forward to them becoming a Web3 onestop search engine
There seems to be a plan to issue NFTs in the future which is considered a crossborder product

7Notion AI
NotionHQs builtin AI function can help users automatically organize notes correct typos list article highlights translate create tables etc
Suitable for scenarios such as copywriting studying etc
There are free trials and the subscription costs 10month

A little bit about us Why SecondBrain Inside thread 
SecondBrain is a concept that is booming recently given the boom in creating second digital brains For this reason we want to get closer to the Spanishspeaking community and create a community around productividad and herramientas digitales
But what are second digital brains They are tools that allow you to manage and organize your information thoughts and tasks Theyre like an extension of your brain allowing you to store and retrieve information efficiently

Text:
Intro
There is an interesting concept in Figma thats used and was presented by multiple people and has different names Placeholder Slots Dummies Layout Blocks and so on
 Placeholder component is the base one
 Placeholder instances may be nested into another  Component
 Placeholder instances nested into  Component instances may be swapped with any other component instances
More details in this video by Adam_RuthendorfPrzewoski
The next step of its evolution is Layout Blocks by MrBiscuit
An issue
I have a base  Placeholder component
 Placeholder instances may be nested into other components  Column here
image2080384 854 KB
What I need is to nest a  Column instance into another  Column instance by swapping one of the  Placeholders
This is needed to customize Auto Layout spacings and other properties
image804564 843 KB
But when I try to do this I see an error message Failed to set component cycle detected
I totally understand why were not allowed to nest instances into their Main components  it will create an endless cycle such as infinite screen share
image1600808 102 KB
But actually it is not endless  we always will have the last one  Placeholder instance as a stop point
image804932 114 KB
My Demo file to better understand whats going on
Possible solutions
There are a couple of solutions that solve this issue but still are not optimal
Have multiple absolutely identical components to nest one into another
image15681242 223 KB
For the upperlevel use a component with more placeholders inside and hide unnecessary ones
image1092644 123 KB

I think the only solution for now is to create a  Main Container component with  slot instances inside Then you need to create also another component for  ColumnRow with variants With this you can upto 2nd level only Unless yo create a similar column component with different name
image1159633 365 KB
nn_summary: The user discusses the concept of Placeholder components in Figma and the issue they face when trying to nest a Column instance into another Column instance, resulting in a "cycle detected" error message. They suggest possible solutions, such as creating a Main Container component with slot instances inside and using Column/Row components with variants, but these are not optimal and only work up to the 2nd level.

Text:
I am working on a large project across multiple teams in different locations Miro has helped us collaborate and work jointly on material that otherwise would have been more challenging to do in other tools This is a quick real time way of working with others even when youre not in the same room
Miro is a fantastic tool that has been invaluable in helping my remote team collaborate and flesh out ideas Its a great help when running workshops to hold content and allow all attendees to add in material and notes
There can be a tendency from time to time to accidentally move windowsboxes on the whiteboards particularly when working with colleagues that have less experience with Miro However this can be remedied with a quick CTRL Z or locking the windows
nn_summary: The user praises Miro for its ability to facilitate collaboration and work across multiple teams, especially in remote locations. They also mention the tool's usefulness in workshops, allowing all attendees to contribute and add notes. The user also mentions the occasional issue with accidentally moving windows/boxes on the whiteboards, which can be remedied with a quick CTRL Z or locking the windows.
