It allows me to collaborate easily with other team members for user research or brainstorming Other tools like Figma do that too but people are uncomfortable using those tools because they are complex or not flexible enough to match the need of the hour
Allows me to share boards with people even if they dont have a Miro account and an app installed People can see each others cursor Scroll and Zoom is very smooth It doesnt have any fixed ways to use it I can use it any way I want
Icons which are available with the Wireframe library are minimal I like the IconFinder as an alternative but it doesnt allow me to change colours easily It also has issues with writing notes It doesnt fix spelling mistakes while writing notes Sometimes it causes a lot of trouble to handle layer ordering If I want to move one layer in frontback of the other it takes a lot of effort

Text:
FigJam lets me my allremote team and our stakeholders quickly and easily collaborate to collect and organize ideas Its incredibly simple and works well for people of all technical skillsets I use it for hours every day
FigJam is simple and flexible  my team and I have used it for everything from workflow diagramming to stakeholder workshops on product vision Weve also trained nondesigners to use the tool in under 2 minutes They love it and even use it when we arent around
The ability to collaborate with nonauthenticated users is incredible but resetting the 24hour timer is a bit tedious I understand there has to be some inconvenience to push for more paid accounts but I wish there was a way to extend those timers I also wish there was a vertical alignment option in the menu bar for moving text to the top or bottom of shapes in addition to horizontal alignment But other than small feature requests like this I have no complaints
nn_summary: Users appreciate FigJam for its simplicity, flexibility, and ease of collaboration with remote teams and stakeholders. They find it useful for various tasks, including workflow diagramming and product vision workshops. However, they suggest improvements such as extending the 24-hour timer for non-authenticated users and adding a vertical alignment option for text within shapes.

Text:
MIRO helps me manage a project schedule with complex deliverables timeline swimlane owners and key crossfunctional dependencies It also helps with basic product roadmap and innovation planning The visual appeal is also helpful as it can serve as a presentation board for senior management presentations
MIRO is an ideal tool for facilitating collaboration across teams or large groups I use it with my teams for a variety of applications including planning project schedules brainstorming ideas mapping out solutions and process flow diagrams It is highly flexible allowing the user to define the structure and content I really like the ease of use and the infinite space which allows you to constantly be adding to existing boards There are many existing templates that help provide a good starting point for collaboration
One of the challenges that weve seen is integration with other software Id like to see a more seamless integration with MS Excelfor instance the ability to capture live Excel spreadsheets in MIRO that are autoupdates as the underlying Excel sheet changes
nn_summary: The user appreciates the collaboration features of Miro, which allow team members to work together regardless of location. They also appreciate the digital whiteboard, which allows teams to capture ideas, organize information, and make decisions in real-time. The user finds the tool easy to use and appreciates the zoom in/zoom out feature. However, they find it challenging to use from mobile internet due to the high-speed internet requirement.

Text:
It allows me to put all the pieces of my project in one place so nothing gets lost When you have an evolving project with research and numerous iterations it helps to be able to see all the info in one place and makes it easier for others to understand the full picture 
 
I also use miro to share out work and do critiques It is easy to have collaborators follow me on the board while I am presenting I will generally share my screen while presenting but it can be hard to see small details so having others in the board helps with this There are comment and sticky notes available for peers to leave feedback too
The board is endless and I can fill it with as much content as I want There is a timer and you can set yourself to be followed around the board which makes critiques easier It is extremely easy to add arrow connections Overall its simple and easy to use
Miro has cool features that are somewhat hidden so I didnt realize they existed for awhile Because boards can fill up easily it helps to share a link for a frame directly and it can be done but its hidden behind a meatball menu There are stickers which come in handy but are hidden behind a plus on the sidebar

Text:
Miro provides an ideal software solution for collecting comments and feedback on wireframe designs showing what they would look like with elements rearranged and sharing them with others we are collaborating with 
Team members can review content in their own time and leave postit notes comments and annotations with the flexibility to be able to draw cut and paste etc to get thoughts across When we provide our feedback to others its very clear which part of the design each piece of feedback relates to and visually shows what we think it should look like
Very flexible easy to use intuitive keyboard shortcuts for adding elements to the board make it quick to get thoughts down Default colours and styles look good 
Easier to navigate than visio
Doesnt have BPMN symbols and swimlane structure where space can easily be added in the middle of a diagram so not well suited for process mapping  I still use visio for that

Text:
Project time line and deliverables The Miro board captures deliverables per stakeholder and when setting up the expectations The timeline is also important for project reach and target goals 
The flexibility allows collaborative input effort etc on processes we are not aware of
Accessible and easy to use Easy for collaboration 
Can track changes and revert changes by looking through history 
Many pathways to build a project from start to finish and a way to organize strategy
Large Miro boards may take time to load Slow page upload would display a blurry board 
Comments are timestamped and call callout stakeholders 
Some setup are not locked so some users may unintentionally move the setup
nn_summary: Users appreciate Figma's collaborative platform, which allows teams to work on ideas creatively and efficiently without needing to be present simultaneously. They particularly enjoy the group collaboration features and the visual aspect of the tool. However, some users find navigating the boards to be slightly challenging and require a mindset adjustment.

Text:
It allows me to collaborate easily with other team members for user research or brainstorming Other tools like Figma do that too but people are uncomfortable using those tools because they are complex or not flexible enough to match the need of the hour
Allows me to share boards with people even if they dont have a Miro account and an app installed People can see each others cursor Scroll and Zoom is very smooth It doesnt have any fixed ways to use it I can use it any way I want
Icons which are available with the Wireframe library are minimal I like the IconFinder as an alternative but it doesnt allow me to change colours easily It also has issues with writing notes It doesnt fix spelling mistakes while writing notes Sometimes it causes a lot of trouble to handle layer ordering If I want to move one layer in frontback of the other it takes a lot of effort
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's ease of collaboration, flexibility, and smooth scrolling and zooming features. However, they find the wireframe library's icons to be minimal and have difficulty changing colors in IconFinder. Additionally, they experience issues with note-taking, such as lack of spell check and challenges in managing layer ordering.

When publishing a library I have to uncheck styles that are not meant to be published and I have to do it every time I publish Sometimes I accidentally publish styles that were meant to help speed up my work within a file but that were not meant to be a part of the library It would be helpful to have an option similar to what Ive added in the mockup above Id like to be able to toggle whether or not a style is meant to be a published style
On a similar note it would be helpful not only to see which items have changed in the library when I publish but also what has changed specifically about those items
Thanks for the feedback Well pass this onto our team for consideration

Text:
we are able to conduct workshops remotely and get even better results than we would have if we were in person on a whiteboard It is also great to have all documentation in the same place
Miro is a intuitive system that anyone can get up to speed and use within 5 min It means that during a workshop you can get tangible outcomes early on A workshop that previously took half a day you can get the same result in 60min Competing tools are somewhat on same level but I prefer the UI of Miro
One downside is that since banking is a regulatory space we are limited in how we can utilise the tool in terms of integration not much to do with Miro but a general downside

nn_summary: The User is benefiting from the product by being able to collate many screenshots and add notes, which allows for more collaboration between viewers. It is also easy to pick up and use, although a start screen for a project would be beneficial for casual users. The User enjoys using Miro for individual work projects and team collaboration. They appreciate the infinite canvas for getting ideas out, as well as the tools for creating lightweight tables and timelines. The User also finds the collaboration tools to be very good. The User finds Miro useful for collating and sharing information, but not as good for linear presentations. They would like a link to share that makes it easier to open and view the information linearly before getting to the full canvas view.

Text:
Miro solves several problems for product managers including collaboration ideation and brainstorming project management prototyping and remote work It provides a centralized platform for product managers to collaborate with their team members and stakeholders regardless of their location Miros digital whiteboard allows product managers to brainstorm and ideate with their team visually organize their ideas and prioritize their tasks It also helps product managers manage their projects effectively create and manage product roadmaps user story maps and agile and Scrum methodologies
Miro is an excellent tool for collaborating and brainstorming with teams remotely Its vast canvas space extensive library of premade templates and userfriendly interface make it easy to create and share ideas visually I particularly like its realtime collaboration feature which allows team members to work together seamlessly regardless of their location Overall Miro is a robust and flexible tool that can be used for various purposes from project management to creative brainstorming sessions
Miros pricing structure could be seen as expensive especially if users only require a few of the advanced features Our enterprise license charges the same cost per user even if most staff only use it intermittently As power users our team gets great value from the product but the accountants just see 60 of the company using it a few times a month and complain loudly 
If using SSO shared boards often link to the online version rather than the native app and the constant signingin can become frustrating
nn_summary: Users appreciate FigJam for enabling remote whiteboarding sessions and seamless collaboration with colleagues, eliminating the need for physical office presence. However, they note that it requires an additional paid subscription separate from Figma.

The number 1 item is dont count on everyone having received your invite to the board when you share If you need someone in a meeting you must have them validate prior that they have access Often I have invited people and then we have had to search for a way to get them in I think this happens if they have an account already in place

Text:
FigJam makes collaboration really easy when conducting remote whiteboarding sessions and allows our team to visually document and easily share useful information
I love that FigJam makes collaboration easy engaging and fun for users of all technical capabilities I also love that my teammates who arent designers or otherwise familiar with Figma have started to adopt it in their own workflows
I think having some more visual options out of the box could be nice making it easier to create a file that looks super customized visually exciting and aligned with our brand ID
nn_summary: The user primarily uses Figma for early creative processes and collaboration with international teams, appreciating its stability and quick whiteboarding capabilities. However, they find the notes feature lacking compared to Google Docs, and face challenges with collaboration restrictions on the unpaid version and security concerns for protecting intellectual property.

Text:
Miro allows multiple users to simultaneously share ideas as visuals within the same space without disruption This feature makes it very helpful for any roadmap planning session A team can always return to a Miro board after to recap what has been shared or continue the work
I find Miro helpful in brainstorming sessions prototyping new digital products or mapping a flow chart It is easy to share and export a Miro file to different formats
I wouldnt say I like that there is no integration between Miro and Microsoft PowerPoint yet and I believe many users have raised the same request Since graphic and drawing tools on Miro are better we want to have the ability to work between the two platforms to present any idea better
nn_summary: Users find Miro valuable for enabling real-time collaboration among distributed teams and appreciate its adaptability for various meetings and workshops. They also like the continuous development of new features. However, some users may need basic training or resources to get accustomed to the navigation and features of the online whiteboarding tool.

Text:
Continuing the discussion from Dynamic number of nested component instances
I have components that might include a number of instances of another component eg rows or columns in a table options in a selectdropdown etc To accomplish this I have to either create a separate variant for each potential number of nested instances or create the component with the maximum possible number of nested instances and make the instances hideable Neither is optimalthe first could lead to a crazy number of variants and the second could result in a large number of hidden layers which hits performance pretty hard
It would be great to be able to specify a component instance to be nested in a parent component then allow an arbitrary number of the nested child instances in instances of the parent component
nn_summary: The user is discussing the difficulty of creating components with a dynamic number of nested instances, and suggests that it would be beneficial to be able to specify a component instance to be nested in a âparentâ component and allow an arbitrary number of the nested âchildâ instances in instances of the parent component.

Text:
It would be extremely useful to have raw SVG paths exposed for the PATH object type Not the path outlines just the d attribute of the path Not having this has make the api essentially unworkable for certain things like when the absolute smallest SVG possible is required
The only way to programmatically get the real path commands for a PATH type object is to go through the image rest api retrieve the svg and parse it to get the d attribute
The only way I know how to achieve this image is to outline a stroke which turns it into a shape then apply a stroke to that shape
If that is what you are doing the information represented by your purple line no longer exists for the node That loss happens when you outline the stroke and all the information we have to provide is the dashed line stroke geometry
Am I understanding that correctly Can you share a file with this node in it if not
image1152379 138 KB
image1062307 215 KB

Sorry  let me try to explain again
In your example  I want to get the path command that draws the black line but what I get out of the API is the path command that draws the outline of the path stroke as if I had clicked outline stroke
yeah sorry if what i was saying wasnt clear i had to outline the black line to get the dashed line if i didnt outline the black line i would get the code you are looking for youre saying the stroke you have isnt outlined and it is returning an outlined path that should not be happening
nn_summary: The user is saying that they had to outline the black line to get the dashed line, and that the API should not be returning an outlined path if the stroke is not outlined.

Text:
I had a problem of trying to show someone the visual design that was in my head By using figjam and an addon to download examples of designs I was able to put together a mockup of a design to collaborate with my team and determine a solution that worked for us The prototype feature meant I was then able to present our mockups to the CEO acting as a functional website The presentation was a hit and we got approval to move forward with the changes
The amount of powerful features built into the free version is incredible Im using Figjam daily from mockups of new websites to even simple UI designs to send to our engineering team The ability to prototype a working design is amazing There are some crazy good addons that you can use to extend the program for insane timesaving benefits
It feels a bit overwhelming when you open it at first and sometimes things may behave unexpectedly because you might not realise one of the settings is enabled eg clip content for a frame
nn_summary: User appreciates Figma's real-time group collaboration and integration of Figjam files, but notes that non-design teams may find it difficult to understand.

Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement

Text:
Im wondering if we are close enough to see a drastic shift in design tools moving away from the top bar sidebar canvas sidebar model Therere examples in this direction eg Play but thats like the other extreme Probably the sweet spot is in the somewhere in the middle
Hierarchy and organisation can maintain their association with the tree model but parts of the props can move to each and every pixel in the canvas
Another way to get inspired and think about this is looking at builders people who physically build stuff like roads gardens houses electrical installations etc There are certain patterns emerging like specialized tools big or small hacks when lacking the tools
They carry a bunch of general tools with them have extra tools nearby and focus on speed orand quality When in multiplayer mode each person has a specialized position or supports the main builder with orchestrated moves Their canvas is always messy to the eye
I think a way for figma to speed up Workflows especially as they want to onboard new users globally would be shortcuts for plugins and a clean up and redesign of all the helpful stuff added everywhere the last year Same idea for other design tools
nn_summary: The user suggests that design tools like Figma could benefit from a shift away from the traditional top bar, sidebar, and canvas model. They propose drawing inspiration from builders who use specialized tools and focus on speed and quality. The user recommends implementing shortcuts for plugins and redesigning the interface to improve workflows and attract new users globally.

Text:
Another problem that Miro solves is the challenge of sharing complex ideas in a simple way Miros range of templates diagrams and sticky notes make it easy to share ideas visually which can be especially helpful for projects that require a lot of detail or complexity This has allowed me to communicate my ideas more effectively with my team members resulting in better collaboration and a more efficient workflow
I have found Miro to be an incredibly powerful tool for collaborating with teams One of the things I like best about Miro is how easy it is to use The interface is intuitive and userfriendly making it simple to get started even for those who are not particularly techsavvy 
The realtime collaboration features in Miro are also incredibly helpful Multiple team members can work on a board simultaneously which helps to streamline the collaborative process and ensure that everyone is on the same page Additionally the platforms extensive range of features such as templates sticky notes and diagrams are highly customizable allowing for greater flexibility when working on projects
One thing that I have found to be a drawback of Miro is its pricing structure While the platform offers a free plan its more advanced features are only available with paid plans which may be expensive for smaller teams or individuals Additionally the platforms extensive range of features can be overwhelming for new users and it may take some time to learn how to use everything effectively However Miros support resources including video tutorials and a user community are quite helpful in getting up to speed quickly

Text:
Hi all I am working on a Figma plugin that needs to import style from our team library Through research I think the way is to first use Figma REST API to get the keys of styles from our library file and the use figmaimportStyleByKeyAsync to import the style However the issue is this requires me to put my Access token in the plugin and I dont want to Is there a way for plugin to authenticate when making REST API calls on behalf of the person who uses the plugin
Or are there any other easier ways to importaccess styles from team library file in plugin Thanks a lot
You have several ways
Users will create their own personal access tokens which will be inserted into the input field of your plugin
Users will open the necessary library files run the plugin there to get the necessary keys return to another file to continue working
Hardcode the keys in the plugin
31 Or add these keys to for example a JSON file that you or anyone else can keep updating as needed

Hi thanks for the reply I see I will give option 3 a try to hard code the keys in the plugin and keep the plugin for internal use first The other ways seem to have some extra steps for people who uses plugin
nn_summary: A user is working on a Figma plugin to import styles from their team library and seeks advice on authenticating REST API calls without using their access token. They received suggestions, including having users create personal access tokens, opening library files to get keys, or hardcoding keys in the plugin. The user plans to try hardcoding the keys and keeping the plugin for internal use initially.

Text:
Miro is helping us work virtually and collaborate in a shared space in a flexible manner We are able to collaborate on mapping existing processes dynamic thought mapping by categories and a general shared space to easily collect thoughts and move them around quickly as the discussion evolves
Miro is excellent for virtual whiteboarding and an excellent live collaboration tool for teams to utilize for a multitude of planning and brainstorming activities
The downsides Ive experienced with Miro is that it can be difficult to organize the boards youve contributed to or are actively participating in vs ones that youve previously contributed to and to separate them by categories I havent found a good way to categorize boards and so they all kind of land on my favorites or recent boards list and thats it then I just have the board names to use to find what Im looking for
nn_summary: Users appreciate Figjam for its collaborative features, such as the ability to hop on a call and brainstorm with music, as well as the prebuilt templates and sticker elements for creative exercises. However, they find it slightly finicky when resizing fonts and desire more design flexibility similar to Figma's full functions.

Text:
Documenting information in diagramsmaps helps the team visualize complex information architecture and align on foundations 
Sketching ideas in low fidelity increases our time to value at early design stages by allowing us to validate concepts before investing in highfidelity visualizations Having a space to collaborate on these lowfidelity designs makes the validation process more efficient and consolidates the thinking 
Using FigJam to share information with less designsavvy coworkers offers a friendly way to collect and organize inspiration or audits
FigJam makes it easy for me to sketch ideas map information in diagrams and collaborate with others Theres just enough design functionality to bring concepts to life without getting lost in the details Additional tools make workshops or brainstorming sessions fun and easy for my nondesigner colleagues to pick up I love having access to communitymade templates and graphics for inspiration
I wish participants could be invited to edit files without having a licensed seat I have run interactive workshops with participants who do not regularly use the tool and getting folks proper access in these cases is a bit tricky In cases where I have colleagues who need temporary access to files I use open sessions but need to reopen them each time the colleague requires edit access
nn_summary: Users find FigJam helpful for visualizing complex information, sketching ideas in low fidelity, and collaborating with non-designer colleagues. However, they wish there was an option to invite participants to edit files without requiring a licensed seat, as it can be challenging to grant temporary access for interactive workshops.

Text:
Describe the problem your experiencing and how your idea helps solve this
When you create an autolayout frame it always defaults to 10px Many design systems call for an 8px grid and in many cases users dont want ANY padding especially where edgetoedge designs are concerned
Ask questions to bring the community into the conversation
What are everyones thoughts about the following solutions
Default autolayout padding based on the big nudge amount in your settings
Allow for tokenization of paddingmargin grids and offer up autolayout parameters based upon those tokens
Allow users to override the padding to 0px at the creation of the autolayout frame by using an alternative key command like ctrlshifta command on mac

Fastest way I found to apply auto layout with 0 paddings 
Select object  optioncmdG  shiftA
Actually even faster Select object  cmdG  shiftA

Text:
This app worked fine as a free user however after becoming a subscribed member I ran into some annoying and suspicious issues I wanted to utilize the AI to see where the limits were and then to eventually use it for academic and creative purposes Of course theres a limit to free uses so I subscribed to a month to see how often I would have to use this and if it was really worth paying for longer I paid 499 for the one month subscription but it wont actually let me use the AI and instead tells me that I need to subscribe but I already have The receipt is in my email as proof that I did pay
My app says I am a subscribed member so why is it denying me member benefits I have tried many things to fix this including restarting my phone restarting the app deleting and downloading the app again logging out and then back in etc Nothing has worked so far Not only do I feel robbed but it almost feels intentional because when I tried to use the AI before paying for a subscription I would only get a message saying that I have run out of free uses but after subscribing it sends me straight to the subscription choice page That gives the impression that the app is purposely not letting me use the AI program even though I have paid for it regardless of if that is actually the case or not Looking through some of the other lower reviews I am not the only one who has ran into this problem Please fix this because it is frustrating to not be able to use what I paid for
Summary I paid for premium but the app isnt letting me actually use premium benefits
Thank you Frustrated Notion User
nn_summary: User experienced issues with the app not allowing them to use the AI program after subscribing, despite having paid for it. They have tried multiple solutions, but none have worked. The user is frustrated and feels robbed, as they feel the app is intentionally not letting them use the AI program.

Text:
Dear NotionHQ
I recently obtained my certification from your platform and while I appreciate the knowledge and skills I gained from the experience I believe its time for a change in your testing methods
NotionHQ Were in 2023 and your current questionandanswer format feels outdated With the vast resources available to us online including Google Notion docs and ChatGPT its unnecessary to rely solely on memorization and rote learning
NotionHQ I suggest implementing a challenge or projectbased approach to make the tests more engaging and interesting Spending an hour answering questions only to fall short of the 70 passing mark feels like a waste of time and time is a valuable commodity for everyone
NotionHQ I understand that obtaining a certification is important but the current system doesnt seem to reflect the dynamic and innovative nature of your platform I hope youll consider updating your testing methods to keep up with the times

Text:
FigJam is the onestop shop for collaboration in my current team and many teams Ive been a part of in the past Its a our virtual whiteboard for lowfidelity ideation brainstorming and alignment activities
I use Figjam daily for all ranges of team collaboration  from rapid ideation to flow mapping and user research planning to facilitating product workshops Its a critical tool for a remotefirst environment and I always appreciate all the ongoing updates that add to usability performance and speed

Text:
Before Figma I had a hard time meeting up with customer requirements for Prototyping and Wireframing of mobile apps and web landing pages I was using Photoshop and it was quite tasking With Figma my designs are easier I complete them faster and I have access to more methods specifically meant for UIUX
It is not as restrictive as other design applications It is very free easy incorporation of external files that contribute to the general design and an interface that even a beginner can get around with ease
Requires a fast internet connection and saves all your work to the cloud so a stable internet connection is a must while working Cloud storage is an appreciable feature but offline functionality is a musthave feature as well
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro for its ability to identify and articulate ideas, as well as its simple and easy-to-use online collaboration features. They particularly enjoy the brainstorming capabilities and integration of frames for storytelling. However, they find Miro expensive due to per-user licensing and would prefer the option to share read-only boards without consuming additional licenses.

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks
nn_summary: User encountered an issue in Figma where an image covers a "Special Offer" label when both are turned into an Auto-Layout frame, even if the label layer is above the image. The issue does not occur when merging text and image into Auto-Layout first and then turning the text into Auto-Layout to give it a fill color. The user suspects a possible bug.

Text:
We want to start using versioning in our projects and we are trying to figure out the best way to do it
The approach that makes more sense to us is to create a new branch on each file for the new version
Our issue is that we have team members working on each version 1 and 2 but we cant create a new feature branch for the version 2 branch we dont have this issue for version 1 because that is the main branch
Our question is if does exist an official way to work with different versions in the same file in order to handle versioning or if there is a better way to do this
Example of what we need
Button v1 branch main
a new feature for Button v1 a new branch from the main branch
Button v2 branch version 2 branch
a new feature for Button v2 a new branch from version 2 branch
The second question is how to handle major minor and patch updates into Figma following semantic versioning definition
Our idea is to handle major changes with branches and minorpatches with version history What do you think
There is a recommended way to handle versioning
nn_summary: The user is seeking advice on using versioning in Figma projects, specifically on creating branches for different versions and handling major, minor, and patch updates. They are considering using branches for major changes and version history for minor/patches, and are asking for recommendations on the best approach.

Text:
Lack of visual communication Traditional communication methods like emails or chats can sometimes make it difficult to convey complex ideas or visualize a concept FigJam solves this problem by providing an easytouse whiteboarding tool that allows teams to quickly create visual representations of their ideas and share them with others
FigJam is a collaborative online whiteboarding tool created by Figma that allows teams to work together in realtime to brainstorm plan and visualize ideas One of the best things about FigJam is its ease of use and intuitive interface which makes it simple for even nondesigners to quickly create diagrams flowcharts wireframes and other types of visual content
sometimes UI could be complicated if youre a user that are not familiar with the FIGMA infinite canvas system that you can scroll a lot and not find the end Aside from that is great
nn_summary: Users appreciate Figma's virtual whiteboarding experience and collaboration features, along with its variety of templates. However, they find some user experiences, such as applying consistent fonts and moving elements on the board, challenging to use.

Text:
Building your own Productivity System can be an overwhelming mess Dont know where to start Or what to include Start with a basic structure and customize to your specific usage needs and style Here are 3 Beginner Tips to help you get started on the right path

Do you use Notion
mikeying77 Yeah I use NotionHQ My system is a Frankenstein mix of PARA GTD Time Blocking and some other productivity methodologies I experiment with a few views to see what I find the most efficient and useful What do you use Mike
Bryanjrlim NotionHQ cool let me know when you do a giveaway for your template or when you have free products
I use a very simple and basic system with Todoist Evernote and Google Calendar
Todoist for tasks Evernote for notes Google Calendar for timebased events
mikeying77 NotionHQ Will do Im working on a give away so will be sure to let you know when I release it Alternatively we can do a 1 on 1 call and I can customize a build specifically for you too If you prefer that instead you can book me for a chat using the link in my profile

Text:
It solves the problem of How can cross functional partners collaborate and share ideas in one space and it helps us get ideas from everyone not the most outspoken person I also use it to quickly organize thoughts on hierarchy
How playful and approachable it is when getting teammates creativity flowing Its nice not to feel like you must create something polished or organized which leaves room for play and creative new ideas
How separate it feels from regular Figma files When Im working on a project I almost want to combine my Figma polished design and Figjam user flows brainstorm notes etc into one place so I dont have to search for or reference both files
nn_summary: Users find Miro valuable for product management, collaboration, brainstorming, and remote work, praising its real-time collaboration feature, vast canvas space, and user-friendly interface. However, some users find the pricing structure expensive, especially for those who use it intermittently, and experience frustration with the constant signing-in when using SSO and shared boards.

Text:

I think having some more visual options out of the box could be nice making it easier to create a file that looks super customized visually exciting and aligned with our brand ID

However, they experience issues with pasted images appearing blurry when zoomed in and would like more options for using GIFs.

Text:
Miro helps us have one place for designs significant milestones and team collaboration It enables work globally and a quicker location to go back and find previous decisions and collaborations
Visual data sharing It is a great place to put pictures and ideas and map processes It is like having a visual management board in the traditional war room but digital so anyone can access it and it is saved Being able to use templates is also huge for getting teams started
It does not integrate well with some apps or display items Tables are still not ideal and it is often better to work in excel and copypaste your data into Miro Scaling can also be a little clunky where it can be harder to keep things visible at a high enough level but also readable when sharing sections 
 
The menus and controls are also not super intuitive It definitely takes time to bring new members up to speed
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro for its centralized design collaboration, visual data sharing, and template features. However, they face challenges with app integration, table functionality, and scaling. Additionally, the interface is not intuitive, making it difficult for new members to learn quickly.

Text:
Styles10241024 513 KB
When publishing a library I have to uncheck styles that are not meant to be published and I have to do it every time I publish Sometimes I accidentally publish styles that were meant to help speed up my work within a file but that were not meant to be a part of the library It would be helpful to have an option similar to what Ive added in the mockup above Id like to be able to toggle whether or not a style is meant to be a published style
On a similar note it would be helpful not only to see which items have changed in the library when I publish but also what has changed specifically about those items
Thanks for the feedback Well pass this onto our team for consideration
nn_summary: The user suggests adding a toggle option for styles in Figma to control whether they should be published or not, as they often accidentally publish styles meant for internal use only. Additionally, they would like to see specific changes in items when publishing a library.

Text:
Ive been looking for an app with the kind of capabilities notion has for sometime but was hesitant to download because of all the reviews relating to its poor performance on the iPad which is where I do most of my work but eventually decided to give it a go since most of the reviews I saw were at least a year old and I figured they might have sorted out the bugs in it by now
They have not Im writing this not 20 minutes after initially downloading and testing it out and its already very clear to me that it simply doesnt work This is only a matter of the interface which I would say is not super intuitive anyway  I could have overlooked that assuming I would get used to it with time  the very basics were not functional Its a battle to do even the simplest actions scrolling down the page selecting a template deleting and creating pages  all the things you rely on regardless of whether the interface is to your liking Was very willing to give this a good try before I disregarded it but I dont even see how that would be possible without risking all of my uni worknotes Definitely needs a rethink which is a shame because according to the reviews it works so well on laptopPC and is obviously very effective But this app is not conducive to working on an iPad which effectively renders the point of having a tool thats supposed to keep everything in one easily accessible place moot because if you use a tablet even if its not your main device you simply cant use it on there and so would either not be able to use your iPad anytime you wanted to make a note or would have to have two separate systems Would 100 give it another go if this problem is fixed but at the moment its just not working
nn_summary: User is disappointed with the app's performance on the iPad, as it is not intuitive and does not work as expected. They initially gave it a try but are now reconsidering their decision due to the issues they encountered. The user suggests a rethink and possible fixes to make the app more effective for iPad users.

Text:
Records for qualification learning are used with personal accounts so that records for qualification learning can be viewed on various devices but anyway shortcomings are conspicuous and difficult to use I dont recommend it at all as an app when you want to watch content across multiple devices
First if you put in a lot of photos character input becomes heavy Its like a bad word processor from a year ago Furthermore when  is inputted it goes into command mode without permission and it becomes like a freeze
After adding AI to the function even if you try to insert a photo with the insertion function press  on the screen it will prioritize AI character input so it now takes about 1 minute to insert the photo The addition of the AI function was a real inconvenience and I can only think that it was added out of complacency Whats more you cant disable the AI function yourself
When I asked for a solution to such a complaint I received a notification that the AI function was disabled but it was not disabled at all and they were left alone and unable to respond to inquiries
nn_summary: User finds the app difficult to use due to its heavy character input and AI function, which takes too long to insert photos and prioritize AI character input. They also find it inconvenient that the AI function cannot be disabled.

Figma helps brainstorm ideas collaboratively with Figjam where they have many tools like a whiteboard mindmaps empathy mapping and more this helps me and the team solve design problems more efficiently in one place It also has the option to comment on the designs which allows me to get feedback from other stakeholders quickly and is very convenient

Text:
Miro solves the visualization problem for my clients by showing how my solutions I sell software work within their business models Using Miro goes beyond the presales process as it also helps to diagram implementation processes identifying the various technical and human aspects of the equation 
 
While words go a long way making a diagram and showing processes stepbystep make operations functional in my line of work Its also great to build business plans for teams as it allows everyone to collaborate without the hindrance of size limitations in a presentation or a document
Miro provides an allhands approach to workflow design where my team can not only collaborate and operate effectively but I can also work my way through various business marketing and sales demands 
 
From collaborations to creating operational plans to designing workflows and chat journeys for my clients Miro is an allencompassing tool to draganddrop design Its easy to use and intuitive giving users a simple approach to anything they desire to illustrate with predesigned templates that make working a breeze
Sometimes the scroll methodology can be a hassle specially when youre first starting to use it While it does impact usability perception its not as much as a hassle once you get the grip of how navigation works within Miro
nn_summary: Users find Miro helpful for visualizing solutions, diagramming implementation processes, and facilitating collaboration in various business aspects. It offers an intuitive drag-and-drop design with pre-designed templates, making it easy to use. However, some users find the scroll methodology challenging initially, affecting usability perception until they become familiar with the navigation.

Its flexible  you can really do almost anything you want with it its not too hard to learn and it makes working remotely and hosting virtual events much easier and more engaging
It can make less techsavvy people feel a bit isolated or left behind in meetings It might be nice to have a very simpleobvious chat option in Miro where folks can suggest additions if they struggle to add a postit which happens
nn_summary: Users find FigJam versatile and useful for small teams with different roles, such as design, development, and content. However, it may be challenging for non-designers to learn.

Text:
Hi all
After the most recent update of Figma  Pushed a couple of days ago prototypes using Figmas nested component prototyping have been affected This has been cross checked on web links  alternative machines
This has new overwrites that arent included and are causing very concerning issues especially on components that use auto layouts This ultimately means if we hadnt complete a round of user testing a couple of weeks prior we would have some serious issues
Is anyone else getting anything similar
Thanks
Alex
I have the same issue and it is not still resolved Was it fixed with the weekend update for everybody else as well
Yeah seems to be fixed for me now Ive named everything back to how it was and its still working
Thanks man works for me after renaming Doesnt work after reseting name back Still better than nothing but it is a real pain as thats part of our design system and i should provide some guideance how to use that component
nn_summary: Users are experiencing issues with Figma's nested component prototyping after a recent update, particularly with auto layouts. The problem has been reported to the support team, and they are now in contact with the user.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
nn_summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Figma helps brainstorm ideas collaboratively with Figjam where they have many tools like a whiteboard mindmaps empathy mapping and more this helps me and the team solve design problems more efficiently in one place It also has the option to comment on the designs which allows me to get feedback from other stakeholders quickly and is very convenient
Figma can be used for UI designing a web application mobile application and other digital experiences Figma is a great application to prototype and test your designs with real users to get feedback before the development Figma has powerful prototyping tools that can help creating great product experiences and has a lot of community resources
A downside of Figma is that you cannot use it without an internet connection it can be an issue when working remotely with unreliable internet its a bit difficult to understand for a biggner
nn_summary: Users find Figma to be an easy-to-use and slick tool for collaboration during PI planning, with some even using it as a PowerPoint replacement. However, they sometimes face difficulty in finding the desired boards.

FigJam lets me my allremote team and our stakeholders quickly and easily collaborate to collect and organize ideas Its incredibly simple and works well for people of all technical skillsets I use it for hours every day
FigJam is simple and flexible  my team and I have used it for everything from workflow diagramming to stakeholder workshops on product vision Weve also trained nondesigners to use the tool in under 2 minutes They love it and even use it when we arent around

Text:
I use Miro mainly for workshoppign internally or with clients I use the consulting plan to balance cost with flexibility and confidentiality I often use miro even during face to face workshops to capture the productions in real time
Overall an excellent choice for facilitating collaboration during workshops and teambased activities Its realtime collaboration capabilities enable users to work together seamlessly whether inperson or remote fostering a more interactive and productive workshop experience The wide range of tools and templates such as mind maps and Kanban boards caters to various use cases making it easy to adapt the platform for different activities Furthermore Miros integration with rich media such as videos and PDF ensures effortless sharing and access to work across platforms streamlining team collaboration
Performance issues can arise when working with large boards or a high number of simultaneous users which may result in lag or slow loading times Additionally the platforms customization options can sometimes feel restrictive especially when users require more flexibility in tailoring Miro to their specific needs
nn_summary: The user works in a consulting company and uses Miro for collaborative workshops due to its user-friendly interface and ease of use for new joiners. However, they face challenges when working with other software and collaborating with external members, which may be due to their organization's security settings.

I love that we are able to collaborate in a creative playful way even when we are not physically in the same room Having the option to create individual workspaces on the same board and then come together to review each others ideas works so well for my team
Id love to see more colours available in the postits  sometimes we run out of unique colours and that restricts our ability to theme information

Text:
Describe the problem your experiencing and how your idea helps solve this
When you create an autolayout frame it always defaults to 10px Many design systems call for an 8px grid and in many cases users dont want ANY padding especially where edgetoedge designs are concerned
Ask questions to bring the community into the conversation
What are everyones thoughts about the following solutions
Default autolayout padding based on the big nudge amount in your settings
Allow for tokenization of paddingmargin grids and offer up autolayout parameters based upon those tokens
Allow users to override the padding to 0px at the creation of the autolayout frame by using an alternative key command like ctrlshifta command on mac

Fastest way I found to apply auto layout with 0 paddings 
Select object  optioncmdG  shiftA
Actually even faster Select object  cmdG  shiftA
nn_summary: Users discuss the issue of autolayout frames in Figma defaulting to 10px padding, which is not suitable for all design systems. They suggest solutions like basing default padding on the big nudge amount in settings, allowing tokenization of padding/margin grids, and using alternative key commands for 0px padding. Some users share their methods for applying auto layout with 0 padding quickly.

Text:
I use Miro for mind maps team whiteboard sessions sprint and product retrospectives collaborative wireframing with Experience designers and could go on with this list It has application with a number of product management tasks
I use Miro for a long list of important product management activities It has a nice set of wireframing tools and is easy for someone who wants to sketch out ideas without using advanced design tools like Figma of Invision I also use it to collaborate with stakeholders within the company when framing problems The team there regularly makes product enhancements that make the tool even better

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Found this thread helpful Share it with fellow indie makers and solopreneurs who could use these tips Lets support each other on our solo business journeys

Text:
Miro gives a remote team a place to collaborate that is accessible on any device with internet access It has become as fast as writing notes by hand rather than the sometimes extensive startup required on other platforms Even rudimentary diagrams and sketches are easy to create in realtime There is an opportunity to have asynchronous discourse through the comments
It is extremely intuitive to get started as a new user It has become an essential tool for remote collaboration on my team of primarily visual thinkers It is easy to go from loose sticky note ideas to a full deliverable sketch or even the final deliverable in some cases The tool is so flexible we have had to apply some rigor as a team to use it consistently and get the most out of comments notes etc 
 
I love that the Miro team is always pushing updates and new features I also like the available training tools templates and frequent presentations hosted by Miro that feature Miro employees as well as outside users
The dislikes are more about features I wish were included such as better interoperability between Miro and Excel as well as data visualization capabilities I would like the ability to create vector symbolsshapes and add custom fonts I also wish that there were more features that catered to printed media  such as the ability to create paragraph styles and formatting templates with labels that could be adjusted on an instancebasis but still referred back to a primary layout
nn_summary: User finds Figjam easy to use and flexible for their needs in aligning key initiatives and brainstorming sessions. However, they face challenges in granting access to others and occasionally experience functionality issues.

Text:
Hi I have an using when using the Figma
When I disable the Chrome Hardware acceleration I am able to open the Figma without any issue albeit slower
But when I enable the chrome hardware acceleration setting everytime I open Figma my browser will flicker once and says that my browser did not support WEBGL
Is there anyway to fix it
I need to enable the hardware acceleration for other chrome features But then I wont be able to use Figma if I do so
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Is this happening on a specific file or all the files
If this is happening on a specific file then it might be possible the file has reached its memory limits
Figma is a browserbased app which means its subjected to a 2GB available memory limit that applies to each browser tab including those in our Desktop App When loading or editing Figma files nears or exceeds this memory limit it can cause performance issues like long load times or crashes
I recommend you to
Reduce the size of the file will usually help with load speed
Reduce the size of individual pages for example by splitting a page into multiple pages will usually help with rendering performance
Hidden layers loading and then hiding a large number of layers especially in components or with images stored in them can cause a high use of available memory on loading
Stacked Masks and Effects like shadows and blurs also take a lot of memory to load
You can find more tips in our Help Center article on how to Reduce memory usage in files that will help you to avoid hitting this limit again
If you are still running into issues despite these workflows you can reach out our support team so they can take a deeper a look into your issues here Hope it helps
Hi Celine_Doan
Its happening to all files actually
Which is weird since i can still access all files without issue if i turned the browser hardware acceleration off
i also tried using my other laptop with the hardware acceleration on to open all the files and it does not have the same issue
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Thank you for the details
Can you also ensure WebGL is enabled in Google Chrome The steps to do this are in this article 
If it is still doesnt fix your issue please reach out to the team by filling this form with all detail you recall WEBGL issue happening to all files affecting browser andor desktop etc here
Our technical team can investigate further Thank you
thanks Celine i followed the steps needed on the article and it still doesnt work
but ill fill the form you provided
Cheers
nn_summary: User experiences browser flickering and WebGL issues when using Figma with Chrome hardware acceleration enabled, affecting all files. The issue doesn't occur when hardware acceleration is disabled or on another laptop. User tried enabling WebGL and following suggested steps, but the problem persists. They will fill out a form for further investigation.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this

Text:
Using new tools to increase the academic workflow is good
However is there a risk of getting overwhelmed
Do you suffer from tech procrastination
AcademicChatter ThePhDPlace PhDVoice A  
Theres literature search tools note taking tools brainstorming tools editing tools time management tools citation tools tools linking among tools And new ones every day
They are good But do you need to use them all
No you dont
Should you try some of them
Sure
There is something like tech procrastination You can go down rabbit holes of tool use trying new ones listening to more YouTube tutorials subscribing to more newsletters
But in the end you still need to do the work as a researcher Nothing can replace thinking lab work
So try new things out and if it makes sense for you the way you work the way you think your topic your personal preferences  fine But you shouldnt feel like youre falling behind if youre not trying out every new thing out there
This is not antitech at all I love exploring new things But they really can be a distraction The FOMO is real They are time drains There are costs
So do your work Do your research And sample these new tools every once in a whilebut dont procrastinate with tech
mrillig Thats why I prefer tools like NotionHQ that combine almost all of them in one client AI tools Notetaking timemanagment etc

Text:
Ive been a designer for a little over 13 years Early in my design career I started feeling like I wanted a more technical role and switched to frontend development
I remember the exact moment that the concept of components and systems thinking clicked for me
At the time I was building custom WordPress themes 
Within my theme Id have a partials folder full of my silly little components
And I had my templates folder full of my silly little templates
Pulling components from my partials folder into my templates enabled me to have really modular maintainable and organised template files
Seeing it all come together was a huge aha moment for me but I didnt know why Â at the time design systems wasnt a wellknown concept
I spent a tonne of time playing with Sass extending classes using mixins and all that fun CSS goodness

Looking back at it now I realise that what I was really kind of doing was implementing a simplified version of component properties
Code felt natural and intuitive  I loved the idea of having a bunch of components that I could pull from and iterate upon rapidly
I wanted to be able to replicate that workflow in design so badly But design tooling wasnt anywhere close to what it is now
Designing in Photoshop involved a tonne of manual copying pasting and replacing The process felt outdated and ineffective and often resulted in a tonne of inconsistencies
I dreamed of a tool that could reflect some of what we do in code even the tiniest bit
When I learned about Figma a few years later it felt like a huge weight had been lifted and my passion for design exploded
Im so grateful to be working at a time where technology is evolving so rapidly and some of the gaps between designdev are starting to thin out
This was a lot of tweets about nothing but I woke up feeling so in love with my career 
And just generally grateful that I get to sit around all day working on design systems architecting components crafting design patterns and collaborating with developers 
I dont think Id be so passionate about my career if figma didnt come around when it did  Its setting the standard of things to come and were only at the beginning
nn_summary: The user has published a new version of the #pagger in the @figma community, which now allows users to assign tags, prevents the state of the pages from being shared between accounts, and allows users to test it as long as they want (not in the same file).

Text: I know it is already compatible but you could make a completely new app very similar to notion but slightly changed so it is more compatible with mobile since its very hard You could change it so underneath the health and feedback there are a selection of buttons that will help navigate around notion and if you make more than 3 pages then you could make it scrollable so you scroll on that small part so it wont get in the way of the buttons or just put them to the side I really like notion but my laptop can barely show a word since its so pixelated and I cant afford a better quality one so Im stuck to my iPad I really think notion has a lot of potential and its already shown on the laptops and computers It just needs some tweaking for mobile users Maybe add a choice to let notion know that you are on mobile instead of making a new app So it gives you a choice as to if you are on phone iPad or computer So it adapts to your screen to make it a more comfortable experience

Text: This review is more about Notion itself than the app After reviewing a bunch of other programs I subscribed to Notion to help build my new businesses internal infrastructure I was happy at first but it seems that the moment anything goes wrong Notion support is less than helpful Ive been going back and forth with Notion support trying to fix some billing issues updating my payment details Notion seems fairly incapable of actually troubleshooting the problem and at this point as I keep getting the same suggestions from different people Im convinced Notion help is running on AI and not an actual human with problem solving skills Despite numerous occasions saying the system wont let me update my payment details and suggesting an actual bug that may be causing the issues their reply was Its so easy you dont even have to log in Please update your information with this link Also to note you only get a reply every 24 hours so after every its so simple update your info communication gets a bit tiresome If youve seen Shs creek this whole exchange was the equivalent of just fold in the cheese  what do you mean  its easy you just fold in the cheese Ive tried to escalate this to a dept manager or someone in tech that would hopefully have the skills beyond its so easy just update your information however the more frustrated I get the less inclined they seem to be to help me Its at the point where Im considering switching to another service which will be a hard decision seeing as we have put a lot of time into building our systems in Notion Also to note despite being told that the old payment info is incorrect and I cannot update my payment details they continue to attempt to bill the old card number and then send me warnings that I need to update my information So let this be a cautionary tale for anyone using Notion for their business  its good until its not At which point you better be able to problem solve on your own Just fold in the cheese
nn_summary: User is seeking advice on how to access Notion and is seeking assistance from the community.

Text:
Miro allows us to work on projects concurrently with multiple users Collaboration sessions dont usually require users to take away update tasks The document gets updated during the collaboration session
I started using Miro when COVID hit and we started working from home We originally started using it as a simple whiteboard replacement As we became more familiar with the tool we saw its power as more than a whiteboard replacement
Miro is very comprehensive The comprehensiveness leads to frequent software updates It becomes a little irritating that whenever you open the software it prompts you to restart to download the updates
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's collaborative capabilities and initially used it as a whiteboard replacement during remote work. However, they find the frequent software updates irritating and disruptive to their workflow.

Text:
I can analyse data in visual form really quickly on Miro  it really helps connect the dots when you can see all of the information in one space it is also really helpful as a collaborative tool  i no longer have to be the single scribe everyone can contribute actively during brainstorming and it really helps with getting open feedback from stakeholders which is not often easy to do verbally i dont think i could be without miro especially in a remote working environment
Working fully remotely Miro is my most frequently used software because there is no other tool that lets me collaborate ideate and present information across screens more easily than Miro I cant say that i even miss physical brainstorming boards because i no longer have to transfer handwritten notes to a digital format  it saves so much time and nothing goes missing its really easy to track information and review past discussions because everything is captured digitally all of the tools and templates are very handy i dont have to think to much about how to structure information  its plug and play and theres so much you can do the interface is very intuitive
Miro on ipad pro could be improved to leverage the capabilities of tablets i use miro exclusively on my computer and hardly ever on the ipad because it is very buggy and takes too long to do what i would normally do on a computer writing is fine but its not enough for me to also use miro on my tablet  its a shame but i guess Freeform is a good simple and free alternative it would also be great if Miro could be used in offline mode with an option to sync once online
nn_summary: The user finds Miro extremely helpful for collaborating and presenting information across screens, especially in a remote working environment. They appreciate the ease of use and the ability to track information and review past discussions. They also appreciate the ability to use Miro on their computer and iPad Pro, but find the software buggy and slow on the iPad. They suggest using Freeform as an alternative to Miro in offline mode.

Text:
The ability to churn through large amounts of data draw correlations and glean new insights Having all information in one place within a visually stimulating format helps explore information in a way not possible via standard means
Very simple and intuitive  the ability for all information in one place with an unlimited whiteboard space  great for collaboration and forming new ideas and making insights
Can become slightly clunky when uploading multiple files  some PDFs prove hard for read I have to continually keep logging in on my work account if it has been inactive for a short while
nn_summary: The product is helping the User to quickly analyse large amounts of data, identify correlations and gain new insights, all within a visually appealing format. Users appreciate the product's simplicity and intuitiveness, as well as its unlimited whiteboard space which is great for collaboration, forming new ideas, and making insights. The User finds that the product can become clunky when uploading multiple files, and some PDFs are difficult to read. Additionally, the User has to continually log in to their work account if it has been inactive for a short while.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
nn_summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Miro helps solve group collaboration on final presentations I had been using InDesign before but couldnt get everyones eyes on my document quickly The ability to brainstorm and share notes when conducting research has also been an important part for my team with some members having fully remote positions
The thing I find most helpful with Miro is the collaboration Instead of sharing versions of documents around or trying to record physical notes in a way for my whole team to see we all have the most current online version that is easy to work with and create beautiful designs
There are few downsides to using Miro sometimes others feel intimidated by using it but usually that changes quick I use Miro to create presentations and designs which works well and creates highresolution documents and while it offers more flexibility in design than PowerPoint I have to be creative to get the designs I want
nn_summary: Users appreciate Miro's ability to facilitate remote collaboration in a hybrid work environment, especially during the pandemic. They find it valuable for documenting workshops, capturing ideas, and brainstorming. However, they mention minor issues with table functionality and shape modification for wireframing.
